story:
A TRYST OF FAITH

“Mmm, this feels good,”  said Garrett, as he eased back into his seat and settled his lanky frame behind the wheel of his mini bus, while simultaneously snuggling closer to Elaine in the passenger seat. After a long day at the office and the usual fight through traffic to take Elaine home; Garrett was ready for their now familiar tête-à-tête in their parking spot under the canopy of the sky.

_____________

FLORIDA, 1986. The religious organization is in its prime and led by newly appointed director, Garrett. It is well-supported; a household name; with many willing volunteers helping it reach its goal.

Garrett and his secretary, Elaine, develop a secret romantic relationship. Elaine’s housemates are uneasy and conflicted with the situation playing out in front of their home every evening after dusk. Elaine’s boyfriend, Ricky, is unceremoniously squeezed out of the picture. When the main housemate, Alicia, intervenes, Elaine and Garrett hatch a plan to destroy Alicia’s reputation, which includes confronting Alicia in a hostile takeover bid of the house.

Feeling outnumbered, Alicia seeks support and exposes Garrett and Elaine to the the youth organization’s board. Garrett is summoned before the board and asked to resign. Garrett leaves his family and moves to North Dakota. Elaine also leaves the organization and secretly follows Garrett to North Dakota.

This fuels an unfolding drama of intrigue, broken lives, denials, cover ups, and the threat of demise of the once gleaming organization, as the consequences of the actions of Garrett and Elaine get ready to hit the fan...

A TRYST OF FAITH is a tale of stolen kisses, broken lives, & hostile takeovers in a high profile, well-known, international religious organization.

Download the first chapter: The Tryst

 

What We Need & What You Will Receive

We've set a target of $10,000 to cover the initial production run which includes expenses such as:

  • Printing and publishing of the first edition of A TRYST OF FAITH
  • Manuscript preparation and formatting
  • Copy editing and proofreading
  • Interior design and cover design
  • Delivery of books
  • Book launch, etc

 

By supporting this fundraiser/pre-order you will essentially:

  1. Get it first.
  2. Get it cheaper.
  3. Get your name in the book.
  4. Get signed copies of the paperback version.
  5. Get extras.
  6. Get a blessing.

 *Note - If demand is high enough, hard back copies will also be made available.

 

About the Author

Eliana loves to tell stories. She does this best by writing in her usual quirky, dramatic, and suspenseful manner.  Writing has been her passion from she was a young child. Her tales can take the form of the benign—such as a falling clock being mistaken for a gunman’s bullet and the subsequent involvement of the police—to more probing social issues.  With each tale she manages to take her readers along so that they feel what she eels; hears what she hears; and sees what she sees.

Eliana attributes her popular writing style to her years of corresponding with her childhood sweetheart in New York in an age without cell phones or even a landline at her disposal. She also communicated in writing with her mom who had been estranged from her from the early age of 3 months.

Eliana also loves to curl up with a good book or movie, or maybe some good music such as jazz, especially if it's raining outside. Her books of choice, which include mystery, suspense, motivational, drama, and biographical, she admits, also impact her writing style.

A Tryst of Faith is the second book that Eliana is writing (with other titles and outlines already planned). The novel has been inspired by real life dramatic events surrounding a major religious organization spanning a period of about 10 years. When the dust settled many lives, including the organization, laid in ruins. Some of the effects are still felt to this day.

Eliana’s long-term goal is to become a fulltime writer/publisher as she has many more interesting stories to tell. In the meantime, she works fulltime as a computer consultant. Indiegogo.com will indeed give her the push that she needs. Stay tuned…

UPDATE: August 27, 2013

17 HOURS TO GO
A HUGE thank you to everyone who has donated to make California Bookstore Day a reality. Although we have fallen short of our fundraising goal, we want to assure you that CBD is DEFINITELY happening! Anything you can give before midnight tonight will allow us to focus more on producing this event and less on fundraising (not our favorite part). Thanks again for your support and happy reading!


UPDATE: August 14, 2013

NEW PERKS from STEPHEN KING!

Pledge $500 and get a signed, shrink-wrapped limited edition hardcover collector's set UNDER THE DOME (valued at $200).

Pledge $200 and receive a first edition Collector's Set of JUST AFTER SUNSET: STORIES, which includes a DVD of the groundbreaking graphic digital entertainment series made for the story "N."

Pledge $250 and receive the complete unabridged audio of 11/22/63 with 30 CDs (valued at $75.00).


A HUGE  Thank You to Stephen King and Simon & Schuster for their generosity. 



UPDATE: August 1, 2013: NEW PERKS!

Pledge $250 and you get to name a character in NYT bestselling author Michelle Richmond's next novel!

Mention Pegasus Books in the notes and get a free (and very cool looking) Pegasus Books book bag (for all that CBD loot!).

 

What is Bookstore Day?

California Bookstore Day, on Saturday May 3, 2014, is a project of the Northern and Southern California Independent Bookseller's Associations, representing more than 300 bookstores.

We believe indie bookstores are an essential part of lively communities, the free-flow of ideas, and the thrill of discovery.

CBD will harness the creative power of authors and publishers in a giant celebration of the written word that will drive readers to brick-and-mortar bookstores. For one day, and one day only, a number of very limited-edition, unique, word-based items and books will be available in more than 100 independent stores across the state. These aren’t your run-of-the-mill signed first editions—these are literature-based art projects, unique books, and collector’s items created for this event only. 

And California is just the first step. We hope to make Bookstore Day a national celebration of good literature and good bookstores in 2015. 

 

Where the Money Goes

The $30,000 we are asking for will help pay for a CBD coordinator to make this all happen. It will fund the massive publicity and marketing effort needed to ensure CBD is a success for every indie bookstore in the state. 

We have lots to do between now and May 3, 2014. We need to:

• Incorporate our logo into collateral materials to help brand the event

• Create a website

• Curate publisher submissions

• Make sure each participating bookstore is in the loop

• Coordinate publicity and marketing campaigns for all CA bookstores

• Launch and sustain and state-wide public outreach campaign

We assure you, no one is getting rich from this campaign. All funds raised will go directly toward making CBD work for the 300 bookstores in CA, the large and small publishers who are participating, and the millions of booklovers in the Golden State.

 

We want your money, but we also want your love

Whether or not you have funds to give, we'd love your help. Please help spread the word of this campaign and California Bookstore Day. Tweet it, Facebook it, make a sandwich board and wear it to work. We can use all the great minds we can get. 

 

Thank you!

 

Our cool CBD bumper sticker. Yours with any donation of $25 or more.

story:
This book is about giving. All proceeds will be donated to help people living with brain injury.

When I was ten years old, my older sister was in a serious car accident and sustained a TBI among many other injuries. That event, many years later, is what inspired me to write this novel. That event also made me realize what fragile creatures we are — physically and metaphysically. But we heal. The phenomenon of healing has always fascinated me. Healing is a process that occurs unwilled. If you break an arm, you don’t have to think about how to make it heal. The bone grows back together. Life is a regenerative enterprise at every level. Life is also — from its smallest, basest, microscopic level to its largest, lumbering form — interconnected. This novel is a documenting of these phenomena: trauma, healing, regeneration, interconnectedness. It’s not only fitting but necessary that it’s commercialization be put to work for the same purpose.

I want to make this process as transparent as possible. When I assert that all proceeds will be donated to benefit people with TBI, I mean the following:

  • 50% will go to The Brain Injury Association of America
  • 50% will be given directly to people I know and love living with Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)

By proceeds, I mean any royalties on sales that I ever receive. I will document the giving on the book's website, posting the dates and amounts of the donations as they occur.

Meanwhile, in the months leading up to the book’s release, there is a lot of promotion that has to take place. Raising awareness about this book and its mission is something I need your help with. I have a modest budget of $5,000.00 for the promotion of this book, which will cover costs such as traveling for the tour, advertising, videography, and honorariums for the performing artists on the book tour. My goal is to raise roughly half of that here with support from the community. I believe the mission of this book requires community support.

See more at: http://amapofeverything.com

This book will be published by Jaded Ibis Press in the spring, 2014.

story:
About My Book

The Challenge Mindset is about the phenomenon of personal challenges -- why they matter and how they change our lives. It examines the anatomy of passion projects, experiments, trial runs, or learning experiences, and what they all have in common, along with the mentality it takes to design and pursue them.

My name is Greg Roth. I’m the author of The Challenge Mindset (so my name is on this book!) About three years ago, I started to notice and research challenges, as alternatives to goal-setting or habit loops or optimization. I wanted to write a different kind of personal development book. Not one that prescribes routines and mastery, but instead emphasizes risk, adventure, discovery, and self-expression.

The Challenge Mindset will help you adopt a new outlook on life: a willingness to experiment, in order to break out of ruts, to learn new skills, to do something remarkable, or to give something cool to the world. This book is a mix of unlikely origin stories, unique passion projects, and recent research, and my own personal experience as someone who’s had over 100 jobs and even more interests.

In this book, you'll learn about what constitutes a challenge, the four types of challenges, the five qualities of a challenge mindset, and how to put them to use in your personal and professional lives, and how they show up in the workplace among great teams and organizations. You'll hear stories like:

  • How a copywriter with no drawing background invented a one-of-a-kind art and consulting company
  • How a scientific researcher used a challenge to change the trajectory of her career and make history
  • How a former addict invented one of the world’s most beloved eating plans
  • How companies use challenges to experiment with new processes

And many other challenges that led their creators down roads and paths they never imagined. If you want inspiring stories, empowering wisdom, and practical frameworks for your own life and work, you will enjoy this book and possibly challenge a friend to read it with you.

The Challenge Mindset is a nonfiction book that speaks to both seasoned professionals and those just starting out in their career, looking to develop the skills to reinvent, or just invent themselves, one project at a time.

 

Outline of The Challenge Mindset

The book is written in three main parts, with a fourth section appendix of practical guides, similar to a workbook.

Part 1 : What are challenges and how do they work?
Contains the introduction + chapters 1-3, which examine what constitutes a challenges, why they are transformative, and how they work, practically and scientifically.

Part 2 : The 5 qualities of a challenge mindset
Contains chapters 4-8, which dig deeper into each of the five qualities of a challenge mindset: curiosity, openness, immersive action, journeyism, and compassionate perspective. Each chapter is devoted to one of these qualities with interweaving stories of challenges, research, findings, and thoughtful digressions.

Part 3: How to use challenges to pursue your personal interests, skills, and goals
Contains chapters 9-12, which provide guides and frameworks for designing personal challenges, the difference between adaptability and optimization, and advice for teams and organizations, plus an epilogue.

Appendix
Contains a collection of guides, tools, resources, and endnotes.

 

How This Works & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are just placeholders)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (i.e. physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts to get maximum exposure when the book is released in spring 2021.

 

My sales goals and what they mean

This crowdfunding campaign is dedicated to helping a first-time author (yours truly) make publishing a reality. I've set up specific milestones to help fund the production of a paperback, hardcover, ebook, and audiobook:

  • When I pre-sell 120 copies (or $5000) of my book, I can publish a paperback and ebook.
  • When I pre-sell 150 copies (or$6000) of my book, I can also publish a hardcover edition.
  • When I pre-sell 200 copies (or $8000) of my book, I can also produce an audiobook.

 

Tiers: Perks and Rewards at multiple levels of support
I am offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • And much more!

 

Extras and Add-ons
In addition to the Perks levels, you have the opportunity to add on extra features, such as:

  • A comprehensive list of all the challenges collected for this book.
  • Group discussion (like a book club) with the author.
  • One-on-one coaching session at a deep discount of my normal rate.

 

Other Ways You Can Help
While supporting my launch through purchasing one of the tiers is the way to help, there are others things you can do to help me publish this book:

  • Post a message to your networks that you've pre-ordered my book.
  • Share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. If you tag 5 people, you will be able to request your own perk (and I have to do it).
  • Forward an email to a few people you think would enjoy this book.
  • Seemlessly work the phrase "challenge mindset" into a Zoom discussion of your friends or co-workers.
  • Be seen reading the book under a tree in the park after you receive your copy.

Please use #challengemindset and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press in any much-appreciated promo you do.

With eternal thanks,

Greg

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm liz yerby, a queer cartoonist living in Portland, OR.  In 2015-2016, I spent an hour or two making comics every day.  I ended up writing about an intense romantic relationship, a series of travels, struggling with depression and anxiety and the slow process of coming out as queer.   By contributing to this campaign, you can not only the pre-order the book, but also help me print copies for fall comics and zine festivals, and help support me in my other art endeavors!

What We Need & What You Get

I need money to print a book and have enough copies for festivals!  Because I'm a nervous person and made this book with dying pens, I thought it would be easier to self-publish rather than to find a publisher.  I've decided to produce my book with create-space, which is very simple.  The book is all laid out and ready to print.

Also, if I am able to print enough books and make more profit, by helping contribute to this indiegogo, you can help me just feel more financially stable!   As a working artist, I'm exhausted!  Currently, I'm working a low-wage job 24-35 hours a week, and spending most of my non day-job days work on comics and art projects.  These projects include among other things: writing new comics, making pieces for art shows, applying for grants, helping run a friend anthology with my comics collective the Sound Grounds Wreckin' Cru, and helping organize the Portland Zine Symposium.  Both saying you like my comics and donating money to this campaign would mean a lot in terms of helping me stay on track!

The Impact

Graphic Novels which are compilations of daily comics are a somewhat novel and nice format.
I've made a wide variety of books myself with the aid of copiers, staplers, a bindfast, and industrial book cutters which are available at the IPRC.  Throughout that process, I've crafted my skills using InDesign to layout books, and also worked on my writing and drawing skills.  I've sold over a hundred copies of a few of my zines!

I'm very excited to be able to share this project with people as a large, cohesive book and not just as images on the internet.

Risks & Challenges
 

I have scheduled out time for the next few months to do art, and that will include sending out indiegogo orders and doing any drawings for people who ask for them.  I am hoping to have it done by mid-november, with plenty of time for these to be out to people for christmas. *ahem* buy your friends a comic book for Christmas.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially help, why not share my campaign? 
thanks, friends!

story:
La Novela

En México la hemorragia imparable provocada por el crimen y la impunidad muestra que esas fuerzas perversas convirtieron este país en un Estado fallido, un Estado Mafioso. Así, la mayoría de los estados de la República cayeron en manos de lo ilegítimo, de cuerpos criminales y rapaces donde no faltará la firma de políticos y empresarios promotores de un capitalismo destructor. Por eso, no sorprende que este país esté lejos de una democracia efectiva. Más bien es, a todas luces, una mafiocracia. Y esta realidad caótica y sangrienta —añádanse las constantes amenazas de Estados Unidos, el Sheriff  del Mundo— ha golpeado despiadadamente a la sociedad mexicana; ella ha sido presa de esa espiral destructiva, a tal punto de flagelarla demencialmente. Pero una legión heroica no ha callado, se niega al silencio. Son ellos, los periodistas —el Cuarto Poder— decididos a luchar contra las bestias del subsuelo; ellos, la voz de la tribu, de la esperanza. Por desgracia, desde el año 2000 más de 140 periodistas mexicanos han perdido la vida y muchos más han sido heridos, amenazados o expulsados de sus ciudades y pueblos. Aun así, las autoridades dicen que los mexicanos vivimos en un Estado de derecho —cuando en los dos últimos sexenios más de 250 mil personas fueron asesinadas y cerca de 50 mil se encuentran desaparecidas—, uno donde el Ejército se encuentra en las calles realizando el trabajo de las policías corruptas y enfrentándose a los fuera de la ley (con las esperadas bajas colaterales entre la población).
            Vivir aquí, pues, en una de las regiones del espanto, me llevó a escribir esta novela cuya historia ocurre en Tijuana, una de las ciudades más peligrosas de la Tierra (en 2018 más de 2500 personas fueron ejecutadas). El lector de este libro tendrá la oportunidad de adentrarse en un mundo ácido, en una urbe marcada por la perversidad de un millonario explotador, un asesino cuyo discurso trabaja para el ultraje y la humillación. O bien será testigo de un periodista de origen humilde que escribe para oponerse a la destrucción de una comunidad; escribe en las páginas de un periódico —y al lado de su guía, hombre de izquierda vociferante y explosivo pero listo para agarrarse a golpes contra los enemigos de los justos— para defender, aguerridamente, a las víctimas del transgresor de la ley. Y el texto dará cabida a un profesor que, imantado por la figura y verbo de Don Quijote —luz imparable, aún cautivante—, decide recorrer la ciudad para dar una batalla justa por quien ya no está en ella debido a su gran pecado: trabajar, intensamente, con su pluma para el bienestar de la comuna. También en esta novela será convocado el quijotesco Che Guevara quien, en otra dimensión y otro tiempo, pisó los caminos ensangrentados de la América Latina cargando dolor e ira. Pero asimismo un sentimiento de piedad que, como una estrella imbatible, sigue vibrando en el firmamento de la noche latinoamericana.
            Bienvenido lector a La batalla por el ausente.

El Autor

Martín Romero, escritor méxicoamericano, nace en 1965 y pasa su infancia en dos ciudades: Mexicali y Tijuana. Cursó una maestría en Literatura Latinoamericana en la Universidad Estatal de San Diego (SDSU). En 1998 mereció el Premio Estatal de Literatura (patrocinado por el Instituto de Cultura de Baja California [ICBC]) en el género de crónica por su libro Comicópolis y en el género de novela con su libro La silla eléctrica. En 2012 apareció su libro de crónica La ciudad de Aristófanes publicado por la Colección Editorial del Centro Cultural Tijuana (CECUT). En 1990 empezó a colaborar en el suplemento cultural Identidad del periódico El Mexicano, en el que publica una columna titulada «Bitácora norteña».

Una Muestra

«Joaquín se levantó temprano. Fue a la cocina y se preparó un licuado de frutas. Luego se sentó en la mesa para ver el amanecer. Lo bebía despacio. Mariscal seguía obsesionado con la muerte de Molina a manos de los sicarios de Claudio Hoffman. Pensaba también que era fácil abandonar su misión de hacer justicia, él que no tenía ningún nexo con la Policía —municipal o del Estado—, pero sabía que algo más grande lo impulsaba a hacer el bien: la voz indestructible de don Quijote. Qué más prueba que ésa, una voz incorruptible que seguía generando prodigios en el mundo; que seguía construyendo sueños cargados de bondad. Pero también se daba cuenta de que aquí, en la ciudad, la presencia de Hoffman avasallaba. Ese corruptor estaba ligado a un poder que lo protegía. Hasta el procurador de justicia del Estado sabía de sus triquiñuelas, pero también se hacía de la vista gorda.
            Mariscal no olvidaba el caso del padre de Sergio quien no tenía las ganas de denunciar a Claudio, aunque siguiera teniendo amistades en la corporación policíaca. De querer colaborar en el caso, don Cristóbal podría dar arranque a una investigación independiente, profesional y valiente; una investigación comprometida con la ley y no una fingida y llena de lagunas y mezquindades. Joaquín pedía una letra en llamas que alumbrara toda oscuridad. Pero don Cristóbal no quiso; además intentó convencer a Mariscal de que era imposible lograr su objetivo: llevar a los tribunales a Hoffman. Pero la antorcha quijotesca iluminaba su sangre; su lumbre lo impulsaba a combatir a Hoffman para hacerlo pagar el crimen cometido contra un periodista.  
            Joaquín pensaba en las decenas de periodistas —como Gonzalo Molina— que habían muerto en el país por escribir con la verdad. Y pensaba también en aquellos que han querido frenar a quienes, como él, buscaban a los culpables de esos homicidios».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Martín Romero os lo agradeceremos.
story_txt:
La Novela
En México la hemorragia imparable provocada por el crimen y la impunidad muestra que esas fuerzas perversas convirtieron este país en un Estado fallido, un Estado Mafioso. Así, la mayoría de los estados de la República cayeron en manos de lo ilegítimo, de cuerpos criminales y rapaces donde no faltará la firma de políticos y empresarios promotores de un capitalismo destructor. Por eso, no sorprende que este país esté lejos de una democracia efectiva. Más bien es, a todas luces, una mafiocracia. Y esta realidad caótica y sangrienta —añádanse las constantes amenazas de Estados Unidos, el Sheriff  del Mundo— ha golpeado despiadadamente a la sociedad mexicana; ella ha sido presa de esa espiral destructiva, a tal punto de flagelarla demencialmente. Pero una legión heroica no ha callado, se niega al silencio. Son ellos, los periodistas —el Cuarto Poder— decididos a luchar contra las bestias del subsuelo; ellos, la voz de la tribu, de la esperanza. Por desgracia, desde el año 2000 más de 140 periodistas mexicanos han perdido la vida y muchos más han sido heridos, amenazados o expulsados de sus ciudades y pueblos. Aun así, las autoridades dicen que los mexicanos vivimos en un Estado de derecho —cuando en los dos últimos sexenios más de 250 mil personas fueron asesinadas y cerca de 50 mil se encuentran desaparecidas—, uno donde el Ejército se encuentra en las calles realizando el trabajo de las policías corruptas y enfrentándose a los fuera de la ley (con las esperadas bajas colaterales entre la población).            Vivir aquí, pues, en una de las regiones del espanto, me llevó a escribir esta novela cuya historia ocurre en Tijuana, una de las ciudades más peligrosas de la Tierra (en 2018 más de 2500 personas fueron ejecutadas). El lector de este libro tendrá la oportunidad de adentrarse en un mundo ácido, en una urbe marcada por la perversidad de un millonario explotador, un asesino cuyo discurso trabaja para el ultraje y la humillación. O bien será testigo de un periodista de origen humilde que escribe para oponerse a la destrucción de una comunidad; escribe en las páginas de un periódico —y al lado de su guía, hombre de izquierda vociferante y explosivo pero listo para agarrarse a golpes contra los enemigos de los justos— para defender, aguerridamente, a las víctimas del transgresor de la ley. Y el texto dará cabida a un profesor que, imantado por la figura y verbo de Don Quijote —luz imparable, aún cautivante—, decide recorrer la ciudad para dar una batalla justa por quien ya no está en ella debido a su gran pecado: trabajar, intensamente, con su pluma para el bienestar de la comuna. También en esta novela será convocado el quijotesco Che Guevara quien, en otra dimensión y otro tiempo, pisó los caminos ensangrentados de la América Latina cargando dolor e ira. Pero asimismo un sentimiento de piedad que, como una estrella imbatible, sigue vibrando en el firmamento de la noche latinoamericana.            Bienvenido lector a La batalla por el ausente.
El Autor
Martín Romero, escritor méxicoamericano, nace en 1965 y pasa su infancia en dos ciudades: Mexicali y Tijuana. Cursó una maestría en Literatura Latinoamericana en la Universidad Estatal de San Diego (SDSU). En 1998 mereció el Premio Estatal de Literatura (patrocinado por el Instituto de Cultura de Baja California [ICBC]) en el género de crónica por su libro Comicópolis y en el género de novela con su libro La silla eléctrica. story:
Story of My Book

Get With The Program discusses why computer science education opportunities need to be available in every school and the difficulties that come about when trying to get these classes into the classroom.

My name is Mary and I am the author of Get With The Program. I wrote this book because schools across the nation are in a dire need for computer science education opportunities from qualified teachers.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance and the power of providing computer science education at all stages of learning. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for computer science education in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you integrate more computer science opportunities within your community.

In this book, you'll learn about diversity in the technology space and it's relation with education and the struggle of attaining teachers for computer science:

The technology field severely lacks diversity which means that implicit biases are being coded into technologies we use every day.

Teachers looking to teach advanced computer science courses must pass a licensing exam which has been compared to taking 3-4 college computer science courses, making it difficult for teachers to earn.

Computer science education relies heavily on funding, meaning that computer science education opportunities are primarily in wealthy areas that can afford licensed teachers and the computers needed for the course, thus continuing the lack of diversity in the technology field.

You will love this book if you have any interest in technology, education, or both.

Get With The Program is a non-fiction book that speaks to education professionals and parents who are looking at computer science opportunities in their own schools and communities for the first time.

The Book - Get With The Program

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. Part 1 dives into the issues behind computer science education and what makes this subject so difficult to bring into the classroom. In these chapters I will talk about accessibility to computer science education and how it correlates with educational equity and the achievement gap. Furthermore, we will go over what a technology course is about and how it is currently being misunderstood.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4 - 6. In this part, we will discuss the role of teachers in the technology space. Teaching computer science is not an easy feat, especially when the subject matter changes every 5 - 10 years considering the speed modern technology is changing. This part focuses on bringing teachers into the computer science space to give our students the best computer science experience.

Part 3 contains Chapters 7 - 9. These chapters will talk specifically on how to implement computer science education into schools. Whether that be introducing a new course or integrating computer science skills into a math lesson, computer science education can (and should) fit into the daily curriculum of all students.

Part 4 contains Chapters 10 - 11. The final chapters in the book will be my suggestions on possible solutions to bringing about more computer science opportunities and making it more accessible for all communities. Additionally, I will talk about the power of technology and where I see the field going.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Audiobook)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring


When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will donate the additional profits to fund scholarships for teacher workshops in support of expanding computer science education.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Mary Newby is an IT Design Analyst for Harley-Davidson, as well as the President of her Alma Mater’s Young Alumni Association and a teacher’s assistant for a Introduction to Computer Science class at a local high school.

Mary has been volunteering for local schools as a teacher’s assistant for computer science classes for two years now. Without the help of herself and volunteers like her, many schools in her area would not have a computer science program. She loves her technology career and wants more young people exposed to the opportunities, growth, and creativity that accompany a job in the field. Unfortunately, many schools do not have a comprehensive computer science program, leaving many students without the chance to explore the subject. Mary is looking for answers as to why computer science education opportunities are so scarce when technology is everywhere!

In her very little free time, Mary spends most of it at home with her cats (cat lady alert!), either reading, cooking, or crafting. She is the fourth of five girls in her family who all reside in the Midwest and is the proud aunt of 6 nieces and nephews, who she hopes will positively benefit from the work she is doing promoting computer science education.

For more information you can connect with Mary at marycnewby@gmail.com and on LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GWTP and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mary Newby

story:
Thank you so much for visiting our page!  We appreciate your interest.

What is this page all about?  What is crowdfunding? 

Crowdfunding is a term that describes the collective effort of individuals who network and pool their money, usually via the Internet, to support efforts initiated by other people or organizations like disaster relief, political campaigns, and support for struggling artists and businesses. Indiegogo, a proven platform that has also collaborated with Barack Obama and JOBS Act, is hosting our campaign through April 13th.  We thank them for making this platform available.

Our objective over the next 60 days is to raise $6000 from your generous contributions made to help buoy our business, which is poised on the cusp of success.

Over the last two years, we have accomplished a great deal here at KLG Press. We've written and published thirty books. We have a rock-bed belief that we can produce much more. We have committed to this company for the benefit of ourselves, our children, and our grandchildren. Ebooks are forever. No more do books have to appear on bookstore shelves for six months then disappear to dusty back store shelves in used bookstores. Ebooks stay green, stay visible, stay selling for as long as the files are maintained. 

With your willingness to talk to friends and families about our campaign and your support, we can take that next growth step for our business.  We can better connect with our readers and provide entertaining, helpful reads while staying rooted in our families and providing for their futures. Our goal is to hit one hundred books published in early 2014. Watch us! Better still, invest in us. We’d truly appreciate your support.

What will this IndieGoGo campaign pay for?

1. Upgrading our computer/technology equipment

Ever had one of those days where your printer took a thirty-minute coffee break in the middle of printing a document? Ever had your computer freeze in the midst of formatting a complicated file? Ever had your computer blue screen and lose a manuscript with thousands of words?

We have. A lot.

When we started this business, we had computer equipment that was commensurate with single writers pursuing singular goals. Now that we’ve branched into publishing and production of high-resolution graphics, our computer equipment is stressed and no longer doing the job without Band-Aids, jury-rigging, and swearing. Our new associate, John, doesn’t currently have a working computer at all. No bueno! In addition, in order to expand into the enormous Apple market without a distributor, we must add a Mac to our current PC arrangement.

And since some of our best-selling titles include cookbooks, we need a new digital camera to produce food images. The included digital capabilities of the cameras we have priced would also allow us to produce higher quality movies than in the past.

Producing our future books with new equipment would transform the production process by ensuring lost data is a thing of the past, making uploads to all our markets faster and smoother, and speeding up the transformation of KLG Press into a more competitive publisher in the global book marketplace.

2. Enhanced marketing work

Our marketing efforts, to-date, have resulted in a total of 50,000 downloads of our 30 titles. (That number includes both paid purchases and numerous freebie giveaway offers.) That may sound like alot.  Unfortunately, it is not.  We have only had the time to do the bare minimum, on a skimpy budget. Engaging marketing campaigns per book take copious amounts of time and dollars to develop.  Funding in our marketing endeavors includes paying for advertising and book marketing companies to promote our work.  It would also pay John a minimal part-time salary to continue developing our social media presence.

Upcoming Marketing and Production Schedule

These are just a few of the books we're planning on either producing or promoting in the next year.  Your support in making this happen is truly appreciated. 

Why Should You Believe in Us?

We’ve already published thirty books, including these ebook successes:

If you’re still wondering about us, check out KLG Media and follow the links to our various blogs. Visit us on Twitter – KLG Press, Worth A Damn Food, Anne M. Carpenter (Tiffany’s fiction pen name), Patti Ann Colt, DayWalkonWater, NatureWords, and JohnMColt. We’re there.

KLG Press, Patti Ann Colt, Anne M. Carpenter, and Worth a Damn Food have Facebook pages and postings dating back several years. You’ll also find us on Goodreads, too: Patti Ann Colt, Anne M. Carpenter, Tiffany Aller, Mark Fredericksen, and WorthaDamnFood.

We have a solid presence established in social media, but more importantly check our book inventories on Barnes and Noble, Amazon, Kobo,  and Smashwords – you’ll find our books with publication dates beginning in May 2011. 25 Cookie Favorites was our first and it’s a winner across the board.

     

ABOUT US:

Know Link Grow LLC started on New Year’s Eve in 2010 as a collaboration between family members Patti Ann Colt and Tiffany Aller. Bringing years of writing experience together, multi-published romance author, Patti, and long-time freelance writer, Tiffany, recognized the possibilities of the burgeoning digital marketplace.

Working together, we organized our creative efforts to position offshoot KLG Press to publish ebooks and print editions for various ereader platforms and print markets. Drawing on our broad ability to write and produce varied content and in association with a few other creative writers, KLG Press has released thirty books in the last two years. Combined with KLG Media, KLG Store, KLG Learn and many blogs and sites, we are poised to jump to the next level of visibility – and to better reach you, the reader.

We are a family-oriented company committed to providing reliable information and quality products to support our readers’ quest for excellence in everyday life. From daily spiritual needs to finding your ancestry, we’ve got you covered. From learning about food to how to have a baby to family support, we’ve got the details to help you learn, cope, and thrive. From the captivating blogs on our media network to the unique products in our store, we have the info and products to enhance your life. Add in great reads from our Press and enjoy your escape into other worlds.

Dream. Relax. Conquer. Succeed.

Or, as was the basis for the name of our company: Have a desire to KNOW more, LINK up with valuable resources, and GROW your toolbox to better manage all aspects of life.

As co-owners of Know Link Grow LLC and KLG Press, we’ve worked hard over the last two years to learn the intricacies of this business – from graphics to book production, from campaign launches to marketing. We do all the work ourselves: web design; book cover development; blog posts; fiction writing; and social media management. That’s us! The modern-day Jills-of-All-Trades. We’ve put in thousands of hours unpaid time. We’ve written hundreds of thousands of words, and produced uncounted quality graphics. We’ve thought and rethought our business objectives as the ebook market exploded with multiple opportunities. Now we’re looking to expand our market reach to additional booksellers and libraries here in the United States, as well as digital access across the globe.

As much as we would love to have that one bestseller that would catapult us into the spotlight, we are realistic about steady growth of our inventory and royalties. This company has been a place where we have respected our talents as writers and have worked hard to produce and publish quality words, books, and products. To that end, we’ve reached the point of needing outside funding for our company to reach the next level. And that’s where you come in! Remember to view our video above and then read our plans for your generous donations. Yes, there will be gifts involved. You’re welcome.
story_txt:
Thank you so much for visiting our page!  We appreciate your interest.
What is this page all about?  What is crowdfunding?  
Crowdfunding is a term that describes the collective effort of individuals who network and pool their money, usually via the Internet, to support efforts initiated by other people or organizations like disaster relief, political campaigns, and support for struggling artists and businesses. Indiegogo, a proven platform that has also collaborated with Barack Obama and JOBS Act, is hosting our campaign through April 13th.  We thank them for making this platform available.
Our objective over the next 60 days is to raise $6000 from your generous contributions made to help buoy our business, which is poised on the cusp of success.
Over the last two years, we have accomplished a great deal here at KLG Press. We've written and published thirty books. We have a rock-bed belief that we can produce much more. We have committed to this company for the benefit of ourselves, our children, and our grandchildren. Ebooks are forever. No more do books have to appear on bookstore shelves for six months then disappear to dusty back store shelves in used bookstores. Ebooks stay green, stay visible, stay selling for as long as the files are maintained. 
With your willingness to talk to friends and families about our campaign and your support, we can take that next growth step for our business.  We can better connect with our readers and provide entertaining, helpful reads while staying rooted in our families and providing for their futures. Our goal is to hit one hundred books published in early 2014. Watch us! Better still, invest in us. We’d truly appreciate your support.
What will this IndieGoGo campaign pay for?
1. Upgrading our computer/technology equipment 
Ever had one of those days where your printer took a thirty-minute coffee break in the middle of printing a document? Ever had your computer freeze in the midst of formatting a complicated file? Ever had your computer blue screen and lose a manuscript with thousands of words?
We have. A lot.
When we started this business, we had computer equipment that was commensurate with single writers pursuing singular goals. Now that we’ve branched into publishing and production of high-resolution graphics, our computer equipment is stressed and no longer doing the job without Band-Aids, jury-rigging, and swearing. Our new associate, John, doesn’t currently have a working computer at all. No bueno! In addition, in order to expand into the enormous Apple market without a distributor, we must add a Mac to our current PC arrangement.
And since some of our best-selling titles include cookbooks, we need a new digital camera to produce food images. The included digital capabilities of the cameras we have priced would also allow us to produce higher quality movies than in the past.
Producing our future books with new equipment would transform the production process by ensuring lost data is a thing of the past, making uploads to all our markets faster and smoother, and speeding up the transformation of KLG Press into a more competitive publisher in the global book marketplace.
2. Enhanced marketing work
Our marketing efforts, to-date, have resulted in a total of 50,000 downloads of our 30 titles. (That number includes both paid purchases and numerous freebie giveaway offers.) That may sound like alot.  Unfortunately, it is not.  We have only had the time to do the bare minimum, on a skimpy budget. Engaging marketing campaigns per book take copious amounts of time and dollars to develop.  Funding in our marketing endeavors includes paying for advertising and book marketing companies to promote our work.  It would also pay John a minimal part-time salary to continue developing our social media presence.
Upcoming Marketing and Production Schedule
These are just a few of the books we're planning on either producing or promoting in the next year.  Your support in making this happen is truly appreciated.  

Why Should You Believe in Us?
We’ve already published thirty books, including these ebook successes:




If you’re still wondering about us, check out KLG Media and follow the links to our various blogs. Visit us on Twitter – KLG Press, Worth A Damn Food, Anne M. Carpenter (Tiffany’s fiction pen name), Patti Ann Colt, DayWalkonWater, NatureWords, and JohnMColt. We’re there. 
KLG Press, Patti Ann Colt, Anne M. Carpenter, and Worth a Damn Food have Facebook pages and postings dating back several years. You’ll also find us on Goodreads, too: Patti Ann Colt, Anne M. Carpenter, Tiffany Aller, Mark Fredericksen, and WorthaDamnFood.
We have a solid presence established in social media, but more importantly check our book inventories on Barnes and Noble, Amazon, Kobo,  and Smashwords – you’ll find our books with publication dates beginning in May 2011. 25 Cookie Favorites was our first and it’s a winner across the board.
      

ABOUT US:



Know Link Grow LLC started on New Year’s Eve in 2010 as a collaboration between family members Patti Ann Colt and Tiffany Aller. Bringing years of writing experience together, multi-published romance author, Patti, and long-time freelance writer, Tiffany, recognized the possibilities of the burgeoning digital marketplace.
Working together, we organized our creative efforts to position offshoot KLG Press to publish ebooks and print editions for various ereader platforms and print markets. Drawing on our broad ability to write and produce varied content and in association with a few other creative writers, KLG Press has released thirty books in the last two years. Combined with KLG Media, KLG Store, KLG Learn and many blogs and sites, we are poised to jump to the next level of visibility – and to better reach you, the reader.
We are a family-oriented company committed to providing reliable information and quality products to support our readers’ quest for excellence in everyday life. From daily spiritual needs to finding your ancestry, we’ve got you covered. From learning about food to how to have a baby to family support, we’ve got the details to help you learn, cope, and thrive. From the captivating blogs on our media network to the unique products in our store, we have the info and products to enhance your life. Add in great reads from our Press and enjoy your escape into other worlds.
Dream. Relax. Conquer. Succeed.
Or, as was the basis for the name of our company: Have a desire to KNOW more, LINK up with valuable resources, and GROW your toolbox to better manage all aspects of life.



As co-owners of Know Link Grow LLC and KLG Press, we’ve worked hard over the last two years to learn the intricacies of this business – from graphics to book production, from campaign launches to marketing. We do all the work ourselves: web design; book cover development; blog posts; fiction writing; and social media management. That’s us! The modern-day Jills-of-All-Trades. We’ve put in thousands of hours unpaid time. We’ve written hundreds of thousands of words, and produced uncounted quality graphics. We’ve thought and rethought our business objectives as the ebook market exploded with multiple opportunities. Now we’re looking to expand our market reach to additional booksellers and libraries here in the United States, as well as digital access across the globe.
As much as we would love to have that one bestseller that would catapult us into the spotlight, we are realistic about steady growth of our inventory and royalties. This company has been a place where we have respected our talents as writers and have worked hard to produce and publish quality words, books, and products. To that end, we’ve reached the point of needing outside funding for our company to reach the next level. And that’s where you come in! Remember to view our video above and then read our plans for your generous donations. Yes, there will be gifts involved. You’re welcome.

story:
My Book -- and Mission!

Be one of the first who can say you helped get my book, Data Dynamite: liberate information to transform our world, into distribution!

It's the indispensable guide to an exciting and creative crusade: to liberate data so that it can improve our lives, and, as the title says, transform our world. Dubious? No matter how important it is, data can’t have that kind of power, can it?

Yes it can! The reason we don’t realize it is that we haven’t had access to that data: policies and technical obstacles kept you and me from access to data. That’s even though our birth records, education, jobs, purchases and other aspects of our lives have been the stuff of that data.

Today, data can be shared instantly, as it is gathered.  However, too many government agencies and businesses still act as if the old rules of data scarcity were still in effect. Far too much data is also trapped in documents rather than easily extracted and usable elsewhere.

Data Dynamite will show that when data  is made available to all who need it and on a real-time basis, that data is transformed into valuable information. Just think how the US government’s decision in 2000 to give free access to Global Positioning System data started a global industry of location-based services that not only is creating billions of dollars of wealth, but also has transformed our lives!

 Data Dynamite tells how a small combination of proven tools let us “tag” data with information that is permanently attached to it, then lets it be transmitted instantly wherever we insert those same tags. 

The Impact

The results of liberating data? 

  • Companies can streamline their supply chains, make better internal decisions by giving all employees the information they need, and even involve the public in finding creative new ways to profit from their data.
  • Government can be leaner, cut regulatory burdens on businesses, and yet actually do a better job protecting us.
  • You and I can take charge of our health care by sharing data that we generate ourselves using smartphones and other devices, reduce our environmental impacts, and simplify our lives.

Yes, free, real-time data really is “dynamite,” just waiting for us to show the vision and determination to make it available. Perhaps the most important argument that we need to liberate data now is made by an expert who says that if one of these systems had been in effect in the mortgage industry during the last decade bad mortgages wouldn't have been written and the whole global financial meltdown would have been avoided! When we do share data, it will blow away our old sense of limits and create a new reality of unprecedented opportunity. "Network Effects" will kick in: the more businesses, agencies and individuals participate, the more each will benefit! Join me on the path toward transformation!

More Detail

The book has eight chapters:

  •  An introduction to the concept of structured data and why we need to liberate data now (whether or not you contribute to the project, please download this chapter, which also gives an overview of the entire book).
  • A chapter each on the simple technology behind the concept and neat new tools to capitalize on it
  • A chapter about the Office of the Chief Technology Officer of the District of Columbia while Vivek Kundra ran it – because DC “OCTO” is the best example I know of to date illustrating all aspects of the “data-centric organization."
  • A chapter each on how data liberation will affect business, government, and our personal lives
  • A conclusion that ends with a liberating data manifesto to motivate readers to become involved in efforts to make data liberation and the data-centric organization a reality.   

A Little About Me!


Writing this book, and becoming involved in the effort to liberate data is the most exciting thing I've done in a lifetime spent on the cutting edge of change.

 I’ve had an eclectic career: day care teacher, TV writer, gubernatorial (Mike Dukakis) press secretary, corporate crisis consultant, environmental strategist, and, currently, homeland security and disaster consultant.  The common thread in my work has been communication – I have a journalism degree and have always loved to explain complex subjects in a way that anyone can understand them.

When it comes to liberating data, I believe the holistic way in which I tend to approach issues means that I’ve created the most comprehensive, and integrated approach to data so far. It’s one that puts data at the core of everything we do, which in turn creates limitless ways to use that data creatively and streamline and unify our lives and work as never before. Glad you’re along for the ride!


What I Need -- and What You Get

The Budget

A key aspect of liberating data is transparency, and since I try to always walk my talk, the spending for "Data Dynamite" will be fully documented here.

I didn't plan on self-publishing, but some significant events led me to it. Vivek Kundra, the first U.S.CIO was to be my co-author, but couldn't continue after he took his new job. O'Reilly was going to publish it.  I've been told (can't confirm it) that the reason why I got a contract so quickly was that Google's Eric Schmidt somehow heard about it and urged Tim O'Reilly to print it. Eventually we parted company (on friendly terms!): as you'd expect, O'Reilly wanted a book more like its how-to books, while I wanted a more evangelistic tone.

But that's all ancient history.  

The biggest downside of self-publishing is paying for the costs such as editing and graphic design that the publisher normally picks up. The budget I've prepared for the final stages of the book publishing process totals $14,000:

  • $5,000 partial living expenses for two months.

  • $4,500 graphic arts, design services (including $1,200 for cover)

  • $1,500 editing

  • $2,500 printing (200 copies for promotion and marketing)

  • $500 for 1000 postcards and mailing for promotion.

  • Indiegogo processing fees

Why am I asking for help?  I’ve really sacrificed my consulting work in the past two years to work on this book, so I simply don’t have the resources to pay these expenses right now. In fact, my wife’s salary plus what I bring in isn’t enough to cover our “nut” right now!

The hardest part of the budget to ask for is $5000 that would give me $3500 in partial living expenses for the next two months. However, I believe that is vital because it would allow me to focus on completing the project instead of worrying about how to pay the bills.

Graphic arts services to design both the e-book and print versions of the book, as well as typography, will run $3,300, plus $1200 for cover design (I hope to get permission from Chris Jordan for one of his stunning and compelling infographics – you owe it to yourself to check them out!)  I'll use SoroDesign, a first-class design firm specializing in e-books.

Editing would cost about $1,500.

I had toyed with the idea of not producing a paper edition at all, since an all-electronic approach would allow much more frequent revisions and more use of illustrations, a must given the visual component of this approach. However, I did decide that print-on-demand technology would make it worthwhile, and decided to go with Lightning Source, highly recommended by SoroDesign.  My plan is to pre-print 200 copies for use in promotion and marketing, which would cost $2500. Copies for sale would be handled on a print-on-demand basis.

Finally, even though most of the marketing for the book would be done through social media, the budget includes $500 for printing and postage to distribute 1,000 illustrated postcards about the book.

 Overall, the budget I’ve created totals $14,000. I think that will allow an attractive and well-edited book while still keeping the overall costs to a bare minimum. If I don't get enough of the goal to be able to produce the book, all contributions will be refunded upon request of the donor.

What You'll get!

  • The first 50 people to donate to the project, no matter what the amount, will get a draft copy within the next three weeks, soliciting their comments as part of the editing process!

  • If you give $15 you'll get an advance copy of the digital version of Data Dynamite, delivered a week before the public release date.

  • If you give $28.00 ($24.99 plus $3 shipping & handling) you'll get an autographed advance copy of the paper version of Data Dynamite, delivered a week before the public release date.   

  • If you give $100 you will get an autographed advance copy of the paper edition plus acknowledgment in the book of your status as a patron.

  • If you give $250 you will get an autographed advance copy of the paper edition, acknowledgment in the book as a patron, and one hour of phone consultation with me on how to begin your organization's transition to a data-centric one.

  • if you give $500 you will get an autographed advance copy of the paper edition, acknowledgment in the book as a patron, and two hours of phone consultation with me on how to begin your organization's transition to a data-centric one.

Other Ways You Can Help

Collaboration is a major aspect of "Data Dynamite: liberate information to transform our world," and I like to walk my talk. Beyond contributing whatever amount you are comfortable with toward my goal of $14,000, I'd really appreciate it if you'd use the collaboration tools on this page, such as Twitter and Facebook (especially to "favorite" it on Facebook and to send a Tweet, both of which you can do directly from the site -- kewl, or what??), to spread the word to your social networks, and, even better, if you'd consider doing an email to your friends and business associates.

I'm sure you'll find Data Dynamite compelling, and once you've read it I'm confident you'll agree it's time to demand that we get access to the data that we have paid for and for which our lives have provided so much raw material. I hope you'll join me in this crusade!

story:
I Want My Daddy To Do It- a children's book about the strong bond between a father and son

When Braylon Prestbury was two years old, his favorite phrase was "I want my daddy to do it." Whether it was helping him with his daily routine-including brushing his teeth and picking out his clothes--or whether it was taking him to the zoo or the store, he always wanted and received help from his father.

I'm Matt Prestbury, a husband, a father, an educator and now author. I wrote I Want My Daddy To Do It ! as a poem to recognize and always remember my son Braylon at that young age of two, when he always wanted the help of his father, me. I then decided to turn it into a book, with the help of illustrator Kuroji Patrick.

I Want My Daddy To Do It ! is written to entertain and delight young children, and to encourage other fathers to either build or strengthen the bond they have with their child(ren). No matter who else was around, be it Braylon's mother, grandmother, or anyone else, he always wanted me to help him achieve whatever it was he set out to achieve. And I was always, always happy to oblige.

Read all about Braylon's day in I Want My Daddy To Do It!

What I Need & What You Get

In order to bring this book to families everywhere I need YOU:

  • My first goal is $300 to cover the illustrator's fee!
  • My second goal is an additional $1700 to cover the costs of publishing and promotion. I need to get copies in people's hands.
  • With a contribution of $25 or more you will receive a copy of I Want My Daddy To Do It!
  • More perks to come. Stay tuned.

The Impact

Fathers play a critical role in children's lives, yet:

  • Far too often fathers are unseen because they are not there, or unseen because they are ignored.
  • Very few publications show positive images of fathers who are there.
  • We can't sit around and wait for any outlet to provide those images. We MUST do this ourselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, there are certainly other ways to help this project come to life:

  • Please spread the word any way that you can, especially through social media.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools for your convenience!
  • Word of mouth is still in style. Please talk to friends, family, members, co-workers and the like about this project and encourage them to support!

Get excited about a project the provides a positive image of a father for our families. Get ready to help make it a reality. And get prepared for many more books to come. THIS is the start of something special.

GET INVOLVED!!

story:
Manifesting the Monkey

Hello and welcome to my fundraiser. Like I say in the video, this novel is the culmination of a process that started when I left my Mother Culture for three and a half years. I learned a lot on my journey and this is a story from that adventure. Although it's based on things that I saw and experienced, it is a fictional story. 


The Impact

This novel is something that has been brewing inside of me for a long time. It's a story, first and foremost. As all good stories it's engaging and the content is intriguing. But after entertainment, I have something to say, something that has grown close to my heart for a long time. It's a story of rediscovering humanity...


Money Stuff:

I am seeking funding for an ISBN, an editor, marketing, cover design, and website development.


Help Manifest the Monkey!

Feel free to pass the word along to your friends and family.

Manifesting the Monkey
Hello and welcome to my fundraiser. Like I say in the video, this novel is the culmination of a process that started when I left my Mother Culture for three and a half years. I learned a lot on my journey and this is a story from that adventure. Although it's based on things that I saw and experienced, it is a fictional story. 


The Impact
This novel is something that has been brewing inside of me for a long time. It's a story, first and foremost. As all good stories it's engaging and the content is intriguing. But after entertainment, I have something to say, something that has grown close to my heart for a long time. It's a story of rediscovering humanity...


Money Stuff:
I am seeking funding for an ISBN, an editor, marketing, cover design, and website development.


Help Manifest the Monkey!
Feel free to pass the word along to your friends and family.

story:
Short Summary

Hannah cradled the newborn in one arm and looked down at the iron skillet in her hand, at the droplet of red dangling from the bottom, about to fall. It broke free, and her eyes followed it to the floor, saw it splash onto the linoleum tile. That bright spatter brought her back to her senses, and suddenly she became aware of the infant screaming as only brand new babies can, of the blood on her face, neck and hands, already turning sticky as it dried, and of her mother. Their mother, lying on the floor with her skull caved in.

She gripped the skillet. “Shhh,” she said absently to the baby. She waited.

Her mother didn’t get up again.

Hannah breathed a sigh of relief, then sucked it back in sharply as the grief of what she’d done hit her like a swift kick to the gut. She dropped the skillet and spun toward the sink. Her last meal hit the drain as the skillet hit the floor. She stayed bent over the sink for a long time, retching even after her stomach had given up everything it had to give. Finally, she rinsed her mouth out, then grabbed a rag and wet it down before shutting off the water.

She slid to the floor, still hugging the baby to her chest. Dried blood and fluid from the birth still coated him, and he’d gotten more of their mother’s blood on him during the fight. Hannah hummed an absent-minded lullaby as she wiped him down. Then she tossed the bloody rag in the sink and leaned over to pull a fresh towel from a nearby basket. She swaddled the baby and held him tight, and for the first time since taking his first breath, he stopped crying.

“Noah,” Hannah whispered, tears burning her eyes and the back of her throat as she cradled her newborn brother. “They wanted to name you Noah.”

She lifted her gaze from the baby to her mother’s disfigured corpse, and her cries took over for the baby’s. She didn’t know what to do next. She wasn’t sure what was happening. And she didn’t understand how the whole world had gone to utter hell before the day had even begun.


This is how the end of the world begins for Hannah Jordan, who emerges from hiding in her family's back yard bomb shelter months after the dead began to walk, only to find a world ruled by vampires who have hearded what's left of humanity into vampire-controlled refugee camps. Read more about Dominion of the Damned here, and click here to read a longer excerpt.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Dominion of the Damned is in the final stages of revision and is scheduled for e-book and paperback release in mid-December. However, it still needs a cover, and good covers cost money. We need to raise a minimum of $250 (Indiegogo won't let you set anything lower than $500 as your goal) in order to purchase the stock photos for the cover, as well as additional photos for use in promotional materials. 

Also, Christmas is coming up, and business has been slow for this family of freelancers, so going over our goal would help make for a very merry Christmas in the Bauhaushold.

What do you get for pre-ordering? WELL!

You get the book FIRST -- we'll ship it as soon as it's ready, so you don't have to wait for the official release date.

You get to see your name listed in the acknowledgements section.

Different contribution levels include different perks, including signed paperback copies, a copy of my novel Restless Spirits, a hand-made, one-of-a-kind zombie doll lovingly crocheted by the author, and a chance to be a character in an upcoming book! See the sidebar for details.

 

The Impact

A good cover can make all the difference in how well a book sells. Pre-ordering your book through this Indiegogo campaign will help to put a quality cover on this book, increasing its chances of selling well on Amazon, Barnes &  Noble, and other online book retail sites.

Also, by purchasing your copy of this book via this campaign, I and my family will receive 100% of the royalties, and we won't have to wait for Amazon to release my royalty payment--we get paid and you get your book(s). Win! \o/

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't get the book right now, that's okay. We've got a $2 donation option that will still get you listed in the acknowledgements. But if even that's too steep for you right now, we understand. You can still help out by telling people about the campaign.

So tweet, like, share, e-mail and use that sound-making thing on your face to get the word out, help Dominion of the Damned get a quality cover, and help the Bauhauses have a merry Christmas!

story:
This year we saw Hillary Clinton take a beating like no candidate in modern history has. Her image, reputation, and record assailed on a daily basis and still she showed grace and "stamina"...

This has been one of the most difficult Elections in the history of our great country. For many of us to watch and endure the vitriol that was spewed toward Hillary Clinton, many of us took it as a personal insult.

Hi! My name is Elle. 

In just a few short days the Electoral College will be voting as a whole and we are facing an even greater fight than we thought we would have to. 

With these stickers, you will be sending a clear and unambiguous statement to Donald J. Trump, his supporters and the world, that no matter what you are still with and forever will be with Hillary Clinton. Now is the time to roll up our sleeves and finish the work that Hillary Clinton has started. I created these stickers as a way to do just that.

Will be donated to help the Electoral College Faithless Electors pay fines and any lawyer fees

story:
This book is a one stop shop of how to understand that you truly are what you eat. I wrote it to dispel the myths and stereotypes about vegetarianism and veganism. My book will be published in February 2020 by New Degree Press.

Story of My Book

The Tarian Diets

My book will discuss the different impacts food has on the world both inside you and the world around you. You will be able to choose a Tarian diet that fits your life. (The suffix “arian” means a person who practices or believes something. Tarian is a word that I made up to easily refer to all the types of diets!)

My name is Jady Chen and I am the author of The Tarian Diets. I wrote this book because I wanted to clear up the misunderstandings for people who don’t eat meat, give reasons why you may want to switch to a vegetarian/vegan diet, but also show you that it’s okay to cheat on your “diet.”

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that food really does play a huge role in our everyday lives. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for eating, cooking, and sharing food in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you figure out what kind of diet and lifestyle works best for you and how it’s a lot easier than you think.

In this book, you'll learn about sustainability, health, and animal ethics from both experts and novices in their fields:

Carbs in the air, carbs in your body — the correlation between what you eat and climate change — with Dr. Richard Plate, an empathetic professor that studies the three pillars of sustainability and the impact we as humans have on our world. 

Give me dairy-free or give me death — our bodies are made differently so no one meal plan is healthy for everyone — with Jamie Joyce, an aspiring and powerful woman who nearly died until she embraced a diet that even her doctor didn't consider. 

Loving the animals you eat — understanding cognitive dissonance and why it’s both okay and not okay for animals to be killed for food — with Lee Perry, a compassionate activist that not only advocates for the lives of animals but also for the people that may not know their stories. 

You will love this book if you’ve tried to go plant-based and found it too annoying or difficult to deal with.
The Tarian Diets is a non-fiction book that speaks to meat-eaters and vegans alike who are looking at a world that is no longer mutually-exclusive for the first time.

 

The Book - The Tarian Diets

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. From sustainability to susceptibility, this part talks about the factors that are affected by consuming animal products. Sustainability from a species prospective — homo sapiens being one of them — how food affects your health, and compassion for creatures big and small. This part will also delve into the formal categories of diets that most people follow.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-15. This part contains stories from people of all different backgrounds and how they have dealt with different diets and how they found the one that works for them.

Part 3 contains Chapters 16-20. The new Tarian diets are introduced and this will be the section that you can choose your own adventure.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Jady Chen is a researcher at heart and loves analyzing all sides to a story. She views diversity and differences as strengths rather than weaknesses. Jady attended the University of Central Florida, a hub for acceptance and a champion of individual differences. She always believes that in order to make global changes, one has to act locally. She works with sustainability projects in her own city to promote environmentally and humanistically responsible behavior.

Jady wrote this book because she also went through all different kinds of diets before she found the one that was the healthiest for her. Jady was tired of all the stereotypes that being vegan or vegetarian had so she wanted to combat these misunderstandings. Jady wants to help others find a diet, and essentially lifestyle, that makes them feel healthy in all aspects — from mental health to physiological health and environmental health.

In the free time that she manages to salvage, Jady likes to be a crazy cat lady and spend time with her four cats. Her friends describe her as dorky and super awkward. Jady will find any way to inject a dad-joke into a conversation. She can also eat a lot more than she looks like she can and often surprises people when she asks for a third helping.

For more information you can connect with Jady at simplejady@gmail.com and on Facebook (Jady Chen) and Instagram (@simplejady)

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. In order to break the status quo, we need to talk about things that may make us comfortable — it may be even considered treason to do so! Please use #JadysTreeson ? and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

With much love and appreciation,
Jady Chen
