story_txt:
I am a heritage breeds farmer in Northeast Georgia raising rare breeds of sheep, rabbits, and hogs. The American Guinea Hog was recently upgraded from Critical to Endangered by The Livestock Conservancy. Just one decade ago, it was on the brink of extinction. When I discovered the breed, I wanted to find out as much as possible about it, but there is very little information out there. This type of swine is unique in many ways, and it must be cared for and raised differently, too. As an educator and researcher in my prior career, I wanted to learn and share this information to other homesteaders like me. 
I will be interviewing current and previous breeders of the American Guinea Hog, as well as chefs who promote its succulent meat and lard. I'm also contacting elders who remember the hog from an earlier time. I will collect their stories, determine themes and patterns, and share the information in book form.  The end product will actually be a series of three books:
Hogs with Heart: Stories and Care of the American Guinea Hog
Historical Hogs with Heart: The Foundation American Guinea Hogs
Succulent Pork and More: The Incomparable Taste and Resourcefulness of America's Homestead Hogs
To find out more about our mission and activities on the farm, you may want to check out our media page. We have recently been featured in September's Acres, USA, in Georgia Organic's The Dirt, and will be on a Podcast in November with Permaculture Voices. My first interview for Permacuture Voices was Episode 10. 
 I am passionate about preserving the American Guinea Hogs for future generations to enjoy. These books will contribute knowledge that will help them continue to thrive and once again dot the landscape of rural America and even urban farms, as zoning allows. How many crowd funding campaigns help protect future food sources, connect people with their food, and save a livestock breed for future generations? By participating in this project, you can truly make a difference!
  Funding Goals
 
I currently have several important interviews completed. Each one is about 90 - 120 minutes long. Even at a competitive rate, transcribing these recorded interviews will cost me $68-90 per interview. If I meet my goal, I will have funds to transcribe about 20 interviews after deducting indiegogo, credit card, and PayPal fees.

I plan to have future fundraisers to cover costs of additional interviews, book cover art, printing, and editing. Any additional funds raised in this fundraiser will be applied to these essential needs. 
If I do not meet my goal, I will not be able to transcribe as many interviews, and the book project will be delayed. 
 I am offering perks very unique to Broad River Pastures that you will not find anywhere else. There is a wide range of perks to meet most budgets. Thank you for supporting our cause! 
 
  The Impact You can Make
 Your support to this project will make a huge difference to me, to the American Guinea Hog, and to current and future stewards of this incredible heritage animal.  
The American Guinea Hog has unique genetic traits and is least related to most other breeds of hogs. If the hog is lost, so are its unique characteristics.
This hog must be raised differently than other breeds, but there is little information out there to help breeders. 

Stories of the hogs and how they were saved from extinction have not been written down and shared with a wider audience. Their stories are important and worthy of preservation. 
 My previous fundraiser, https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-save-he..., provided me with seed money to purchase, house, and fence in our initial herd of American Guinea Hogs. Just thirteen months later, we were blessed with 37 piglets from our first 5 farrowings! My former campaign perks were delivered promptly with only a few delays. My backers were appreciative and very supportive. Photos of our hogs are available at our website. I have a good track record with this type of fundraiser.
 
  Risks & Challenges  At this point I do not know when my writing project will be finalized in book form. The modest goal of this particular campaign will not get me to that point, but will go a long way in amassing the raw interview material in transcribed form that will allow me to begin analysis and organization into a book.  
My history of completing a doctoral dissertation from 1996-2004 indicates that I do not give up on long term research projects and have the ability to synthesize interviews into a readable form. 
 I will repeat fundraising efforts as needed in order to keep this project going without putting myself in debt for the project. 

Perks will be distributed on time prior to writing the book. My intention is to complete my first book in 2015. 
 
  Other Ways You Can Help
Can't commit cash at this time? That's okay!

You can still help by linking to the campaign on your social media tools! It doesn't cost a cent to share!
Please note that if you do make a contribution, funds paid via PayPal will be available to me immediately. I don't believe that you need a PayPal account to make a payment to PayPal using your credit card. Funds paid with a credit card but not through PayPal will not be received until mid December. Thank you to those who contribute via PayPal!

story:
ATENÇÃO: quem não estiver a conseguir contribuir agora, por favor contacte-me directamente para: 
raquel.caldevilla@gmail.com 
(ou através do facebook) 
OBRIGADA!!



(For Portuguese scroll down)
(Para o texto em Português, veja abaixo)


Me and my story

Hi there!

My name is Raquel Caldevilla and I’m a 30 years old Portuguese girl, from the lovely city of Porto.

When I was little, I always wanted to work with people, to see how they were and act. So I became a psychologist specialized in Expressive/Creative Therapies (art, music, dance and drama/theatre) and since then I began working with children, one of the things that I love most. I was focused on helping searching our inner child, that piece of innocence that makes us sincerest, simpler, and more honest.

A few months ago, I created a personal blog, where I write about my daily inspirations on real people, those around me, such as family, friends or simply those who cross my path every day.  The reaction was so positive that I started to write more and creating other stories. I decided to compile a book about twelve people, a collection of short stories, a series of tales. The main bond between them is my background, each one of them has a rare psychological condition, although it’s not the central narrative of the stories. Children see things in a simple way so does each character in my book, that’s why their disease is just secondary in each story. 


12 - The Book and the project

I wanted to talk about serious issues in an easy going way, so even the object has to be simple. It will look like a children’s book, it will feel like one, but each story has a depth that only adults can understand. I cannot do it on my own, that’s why I invited a bunch of creative people to help me. Meet:

- Fred Gomes, designer, photographer and a man of a thousand ways, he will help with videos, photography and the book design.

- Mariana, the Miserable one, she’s an amazing illustrator with an unique point of view. She’ll do the illustrations for each tale.

- The girls from beija-flor, a project that creates handcrafted notebooks, specially to thank each one of you.

- And finally John Almeida, a musician and an awesome writer. He will be in charge of the English translation.

It is ambitious and involves a lot of people that’s why I need 4000€. So I come to ask you for your help to edit my first book, a book of short stories inspired by real people. 


How can you help?

First of all, thank you so much for just standing there and read about my project. Your contribution can be in a various number of ways, specially written in a list on your right, in a series of perks.

However, I understand if you cannot contribute with money, so I come to ask you to tell your friends about my story and share my project through social media like Facebook, Youtube or Twitter. Here is the link to my Facebook fan page where you can see everything that I write in my blog and also know a little more about myself.

Please share this with your friends and family so I can achieve my goal!

Thanks so much in advance!


Português


Eu e a minha história

Olá!

O meu nome é Raquel Caldevilla, tenho 30 anos e sou do Porto.

Desde pequena que sempre desejei trabalhar com pessoas, vendo como eram e agiam. Assim, fiz o curso de Psicologia e especializei-me em Terapias Expressivas (arte, música, dança e teatro em terapia) e logo comecei a elaborar o meu trabalho com crianças, uma das coisas que mais gosto de fazer. O meu foco era ajudar a encontrar a nossa criança interior, aquela inocência que nos faz mais sinceros, mais simples e mais honestos.

Há uns meses criei um blog pessoal, onde escrevo sobre as minhas inspirações diárias em pessoas reais, especialmente aqueles que me rodeiam, como a família, os amigos, ou simplesmente aqueles que cruzam o meu caminho todos os dias. A reacção foi tão positiva que comecei a escrever mais e outras histórias. Foi então que decidi compilar um livro sobre doze pessoas, numa colecção de contos. O elo de ligação entre eles é o meu conhecimento, já que todos eles têm uma condição psicológica rara, embora isso não seja a narrativa central das histórias. As crianças vêm as coisas duma maneira simples e assim são as personagens do meu livro, por isso é que as suas doenças são apenas secundárias.


12 - O Livro e o Projecto

Queria falar de assuntos sérios duma maneira descontraída, por isso até o objecto tinha de ser simples. Terá o aspecto dum livro de contos infantis, mas cada história terá a profundidade que só os adultos conseguem entender. Eu não era capaz de o fazer sozinha, por isso convidei vários criativos para me ajudarem. Conheçam:

- O Fred Gomes, designer, fotógrafo e homem das mil funções. Ele vai ajudar-me com os vídeos, fotografias e o design do livro.

- A Mariana a Miserável, uma ilustradora fantástica, com um ponto de vista único sobre o mundo. Ela irá fazer as ilustrações para cada conto.

- As meninas do beija-flor, um projecto onde se criam cadernos à mão, especialmente para agradecer a cada um de vocês.

- E finalmente o John Almeida, um músico e um escritor incrível. Ele vai estar responsável pela tradução do livro para inglês.

É um projecto ambicioso e envolve muitas pessoas, por isso preciso de 4000€. Assim, venho pedir-vos a vossa ajuda para editar o meu primeiro livro, um livro de contos inspirados em pessoas reais.


Como pode ajudar?

Em primeiro lugar, queria agradecer pela atenção e disponibilidade em ver o meu vídeo, ler a minha história e saber mais sobre este projecto. Se estiver interessado em contribuir, existe uma lista de maneiras para o fazer, do lado direito. 

De qualquer maneira, entendo se não me puder ajudar monetariamente e apenas peço para que partilhe esta história com os seus amigos e familiares, através das redes sociais, do Facebook, do Youtube ou do Twitter. Aqui está o link da minha página de Facebook profissional, onde poderá conhecer mais sobre o meu blog e também saber um pouco mais sobre mim mesma. 

Por favor partilhe bastante este projecto para que eu possa atingir o meu objectivo!

Muito obrigada por tudo!


P.S. A todos os que tiverem dificuldade de ajudar através do PayPal, por favor contactem-me através do email - raquel.caldevilla@gmail.com - para que vos possa fornecer outros detalhes. Obrigada!

story:
Thanks to everyone who contributed to our project. Our campaign in Indiegogo is closed, but you can still support us at https://give.berkeley.edu/browse/?u=39


"I want freedom, the right to self-expression, everybody's right to beautiful, radiant things." Emma Goldman, Living My Life 


We need your help to publish the last volume of our long running book series, "Emma Goldman: The American Years," and to continue to provide valuable research opportunities for students and the public. 


The Emma Goldman Papers is part of a national initiative to retrieve the papers of individuals whose life work has had a lasting impact on the course of American history. Emma Goldman (1869-1940) was a tireless advocate of free expression and social justice. Her papers are a treasure trove of women’s, immigration, ethnic, transnational, political, cultural, sexual, and civil liberties histories.  In keeping with her spirit, the Emma Goldman Papers Project’s focus is, and always has been, on public education through open access to original sources. 

Since 1980, the Project has located, copied, identified, organized, and published over 22,000 documents previously unavailable or little known, not only about Emma Goldman but also focused on the political and cultural milieu surrounding her life and work. Currently, we are composing the last volume of our four-part documentary history series, Emma Goldman: A Documentary History of The American Years (1890-1919). The last volume, covering the years of 1917-1919, resonates strongly with concerns about immigration and deportation law, surveillance, limitations on free speech in times of national crisis, prison conditions, and the fragility of citizenship for those who were not born in the U.S. 


Many minds, many opportunities. 


As Dr. Candace Falk acknowledges, "collaboration is the core component of the Emma Goldman Papers Project. For over thirty years, many hands have created what has become a secular cathedral to the remembrance of things past and almost forgotten. Every effort, large and small, built the structure, added complexity and nuance to the work, and confirmed the importance of situating advocates of free expression into the historical record as a lasting tribute to courageous spirits." The project provides students the rare opportunity to engage in political theory, critical writing skills, and historical research with authentic primary documents. We believe these resources have not only launched many students, volunteers, and community members into careers of activism, education, and writing, but also enriched their personal lives. 


Above: Three of the volumes produced so far by the Emma Goldman Papers Project, see Vol.1, Vol.2, andVol.3 here. The project has enlisted the work of numerous scholars to compose each volume, including Candace Falk (Love, Anarchy and Emma Goldman), Barry Pateman (Chomsky on Anarchism), Leon Litwack (Been in the Storm So Long), Robert Cohen (Freedoms' Orator: Mario Savio and the Radical Legacy of the 1960s), countless students, volunteers, and many others. Our work is truly collaborative. 


A record funding crisis.


Though the Emma Goldman Papers is a teaching, research and education unit, an archive, and a solid public history and campus outreach group, inconsistent funding has been a source of anxiety for many years. Additionally, due to financial difficulties within the University of California system, we remain part of the university but without direct funding for the editorial staff and day-to-day expenses of the project—this is an incredible burden most comparable projects do not have to assume. The controversy surrounding Goldman--as a woman deported from America, who challenged involuntary conscription, misuse of government power, sexual mores, and actively promoted unlimited free expression--sometimes adds a political edge to our capacity to maintain steady funding. With the loss of direct university funding, our staff, offices, and resources have shrunk. The Emma Goldman Papers' tiny office now seems a bit like a dazzling vest pocket park. 

This year has been especially difficult for our project. The loss of longtime and important staff, in addition to severe financial constraints, impeded the project's ability to finish our fourth and last volume. Your generous contribution would make an immense difference, not only in furthering our goal to make public thousands of historical documents, but also our campaigns to teach and the publication of our last book. Anything you contribute would go towards digitizing our archives for the public, in the spirit of Emma Goldman's "sweet comradery," and publishing our last documentary volume, which covers the war years 1917-1919. 


What we will do with your help.


Your contribution will be put to use immediately. Anything you contribute would go towards digitizing the tens of thousands of documents in our archive for the public, as well as covering the cost of publishing our last documentary volume. We, as students, authors, volunteers, and teachers, remain committed to Emma's vision of creating a community of peers across borders. Our hope is to make the countless letters, periodicals, newspapers, teaching resources, and rare photographs, available to the public free of charge through digitization. Moreover, we will use your funds to ensure the Emma Goldman Papers Project remain a valuable teaching resource, both for those interested in pursuing similar work as well as those who wish to learn research, writing, and archival skills necessary for other fields. 


June 27 is Emma Goldman's birthday—please consider sending a birthday donation in her memory! 


Emma Goldman speaking from an open car to a crowd of garment workers at Union Square, New York, on May 20, 1916.


"…I was delighted to learn, some years ago, of the project, headed by Candace Falk, to begin the collection of the Emma Goldman Papers. […] I can think of few things more important, in the situation of the United States today, than to bring the word, the spirit of Emma Goldman to ever larger numbers of Americans." — Howard Zinn, author of A People's History of the United States.

story:
Mi nombre es Claudia Del Rivero, desde que era muy pequeña he querido conocer Praga con la simple idea de poder estar entre sus calles tomando fotografías, el año pasado realicé una serie fotográfica llamada "Distensión imaginaria" basada en el análisis de la complejidad en la que nos envolvemos los seres humanos, esta la presente por medio de un correo electrónico a la embajada de México en Praga y me respondieron interesados en mi propuesta para exponerla en Octubre del 2014, esperaba tener un apoyo por parte del gobierno de México para cubrir una parte de los gastos para el viaje y llevar la obra pero hubo recorte de fondos para las áreas de cultura y por tanto no me pudieron brindar ningún tipo de apoyo económico, es por ello que para mi es muy importante reunir el dinero, pues la exposición es un hecho, el problema es llegar a Praga. Con esta exposición considero que mostraría al mundo que en México no sólo hay artistas que defiendan el arte de manera nacional representando sus estados o país sino que también existimos artistas más conceptuales que también podemos poner en alto el nombre de México.

Puedes ver el trabajo accediendo a: http://goo.gl/0D6Uhl

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My name is Claudia Del Rivero, since I was very little I wanted to visit Prague with the simple idea to be among the streets taking pictures , last year I did a photographic series called " imaginary Distension " based on the analysis of the complexity that usually humans get involved, last year through I sent an email to the Embassy of Mexico in Prague to show them my work and they were interested in my proposal  so they invited me to display the exhibit in October 2014 , I expected to have support from the government of Mexico to cover a part of the expenses for the trip but on January the embassy let me know that the goverment cut funds to the areas of culture and therefore could not give me any financial support , which is why it is very important to me to raise the money , because the exhibit is a fact , the problem is how I can take my prints to Prague. With this exhibition, I believe it would show the world that in Mexico there are not only artists who defend national  art representing their state or country but also exist conceptual mexican artists who can also put up the name of Mexico .

You can see my work by clicking http://goo.gl/0D6Uhl


              


La cantidad final son $ 4,500 Usd para cubrir los gastos de viaje como transporte, comidas, hospedaje e impresiones, de no lograr la meta final el dinero que se junte ayudará a que el presupuesto se recorte de tal manera que vea la posibilidad de pedir un préstamo o conseguir patrocinadores que me puedan apoyar con el dinero restante que falte.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The final amount is $ 4,500 USD to cover travel expenses such as transportation, meals, lodging and print, not to achieve the ultimate goal gather the money will help cut the budget so I can find the possibility of requesting a loan or get sponsors who can support me with the remaining money missing.

                                   

                 

               


Como colaborador de este proyecto estás siendo partícipe de la realización de un sueño y por el otro lado también serás reconocido por mi parte durante la exposición en Praga pues gracias a ti no podría haber llegado a mostrar mi trabajo. 

Si te gusta este proyecto pero te es imposible colaborar con alguna donación económica, también me puedes ayudar creyendo como yo en este proyecto y compartiendo con tus amigos y conocidos la liga de la campaña a través de las herramientas que indiegogo provee o compartiendo el link de la misma.

Te agradezco de todo corazón la confianza que tienes en mi para ayudarme a llegar a la exposición de la cual formo parte.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As a contributor to this project you are to be a participant in the realization of a dream and on the other hand you will also be named during the exhibition in Prague because thanks to you I wouldn´t be able to get to Prague and show them my work. 

If you like this project, but it is impossible to you to help with any financial donation you can help me as I also believing in this project and sharing with your friends the campaign link through indiegogo tools or sharing the link by copy paste.

Thank you with from the bottom of my heart your confidence in me by helping me get to the exhibit.

story:
¿Qué?

Alguien, un amigo, me relató un hecho que tuvo lugar allí, en su villa. En un lugar tranquilo, reposado y aparentemente feliz. La historia era horrenda, descarnada. La condición humana llevada a los lindes de la crueldad y el sinsentido. La ceguera de unos años que insisten en no alejarse nunca del recuerdo.

Decidí contarla desde el lado de los victimarios, desde esa óptica que nos resulta tan lejana y desconocida, pero que vive en nosotros, en nuestros miedos, en nuestras bestias interiores. Dependiendo de a qué parte alimentemos, así transitaremos por la vida. Pero nadie se libra… O casi nadie.

Un niño ciego y otro que hace de lazarillo, dos almas ¿inocentes? nos abren las puertas de las que no sabemos si saldrá el tigre o la doncella. La luz o la oscuridad.

¿Jugáis?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Luz Darriba.

Nacida en Montevideo, Uruguay, se traslada en su adolescencia a Buenos Aires, Argentina, y ha vivido desde 1990 en Europa, principalmente en España.

Hija de la diáspora gallega en el Río de la Plata, se formó como artista multidisciplinar en Buenos Aires y estudio en la UBA Bellas Artes y Filosofía y Letras.

Y como artista, Luz Darriba, ha realizado cientos de exposiciones así como macro intervenciones en emblemáticos espacios públicos y ha recibido numerosas distinciones internacionales. Anteriormente había formado parte del staff permanente de la revista digital Foeminas y escrito artículos para diferentes periódicos de Galicia. En 2010 decide retomar de forma comprometida su vieja vocación literaria. Escribe y publica de forma autogestionaria Toda la gente errante, su primera novela. Desde entonces, ya van cuatro y más de un centenar de relatos.

En 2011 recibe el Premio Ánxel Fole de relato corto, el 3º premio del certamen de relato corto de la Federación de Asociaciones Gallegas de la República Argentina y el 2º premio de relato de la Casa de Galicia en Frankfurt. En 2014 gana el Primer certamen de relatos por la igualdad, de San Sadurniño. Sus relatos forman parte de numerosas antologías en España y Latinoamérica como Bovarismos, antología de relatos escritos por mujeres. Escribe una columna quincenal en SERMOS Galicia y colabora con distintas publicaciones internacionales.

Luz Darriba no tiene ya nada que demostrar.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 700€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Juguetes para niños ciegos que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Luz Darriba vea publicada su obra. 

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
***Update: Please be sure to select your perk when you decide on your support tier. If you just want to donate, I really appreciate the support, but I want to make sure everyone gets a copy of the book that wants one! ***

Synopsis:


About the book:

The Warrior series is about the choices we make and the choices that are forced upon us. It is a story about finding purpose, love and peace with ourselves and the lives we create.

Why preorder?

Your support allows me to pay for the first print run of the book at a discounted rate. This allows me to offer the book to you with bonuses like fantastic artwork at a discount. Without having to pay for all expenses out of pocket, I am able to focus on the work itself and pour my creative energy into book 2 to get it ready to print. 

Why self publish?

Big publishing houses don't have the luxury of printing unknown authors very often. It is risky and the chance of making a profit is incredibly low. Often times, they have a specific type of material they want to package and sell in a specific way. My story doesn't fit a genre perfectly, and I don't want to force it to be something different.

A Warrior's Guilt is a book that is near and dear to me. I began working on it as a side project over ten years ago. I pulled it back out a few years ago, and realized how much I loved this story and these characters. I decided to rewrite it for myself. What I ended up creating was a story of lives intertwining, people changing each other for better and worse, loss, regret, finding strength when all hope is lost, love and growth. I hope this story touches you, entertains you, and maybe gets you to laugh a few times.

By self publishing, I did not have to censor myself or the story I wanted to tell. That is what I want to share with you. The biggest downfall of self publishing is its price, since printers have to be paid up front for manuscripts or for the additional cost of print on demand availability. Both raise the cost of the manuscript much higher than a traditional paperback, printed in publishing houses.

After this pre-order print run, the book will be made available through print on demand sales at a retail price that I have no control over. It is determined by the print company and Amazon. By preordering, you will allow me to purchase the books in volume, dropping the price down to a closer to mass market price level and allowing me to pass that discount directly to you.

So, this is a series?

A Warrior's Guilt is book one. It is 100% completed and ready to be printed and shipped.

A Warrior's Repentance is book two. It will be released in the spring of 2016. It is more than halfway done currently.

A Warrior's Absolution is book three. It will be released in the spring of 2017. It has been outlined and prepared. This is the intended end of the series, but you know how characters can be. They tend to take on a life of their own, and one more book might be in order...

Where is the money going?

  • 49% to Printing and production of physical books and perks
  • 17% to Shipping
  • 13% Legal fees  This includes barcodes, official copyright filing with the Library of Congress, the ISBN (International Standard Book Number). This is a required registration in order to distribute book and book like products to booksellers, libraries, universities, wholesalers and other distributors. The barcodes are required for larger companies to catalogue my books. Each edition of a book (hardcover/softcover) requires a different ISBN and barcode. 
  • 12% Marketing
  • 9% Indiegogo/ Paypal/ Credit card payment fees. 

Any money raised beyond the goal will simply go towards a larger print run, and to securing ISBNs and barcodes for the rest of the series.

Ebooks?

I am a huge fan of physical books. I love the way they feel, the touch and smell of paper, holding a book in my hands. I currently do not have plans to distribute this series as an ebook. That may change in the future. As I wrote earlier, I have put a lot of thought, time, and money into the creation of the physical object and would prefer to share it in that form.

Risks:

This book is completed and already set to publish. I have already received a proof of the first book and have prepared it for distribution. At the end of the pre-order period, the full order will be sent to press. Printing will take 4-5 weeks. As soon as the printers get the books to me, they will be packed with care and shipped your way. The proofs arrived in less than 2 weeks from ordering, so I expect that the full run will come in a timely fashion. I will update through indiegogo should any problems in printing or shipments arise. 

Perks:

There are several support tiers for this pre-print campaign.  For details on each, please see the listing running down the right side of the page. All levels include shipping within the US. Outside of the US, please add a small shipping fee.

The exclusive art book will ONLY be available through this campaign and in a very limited quantity. It contains visual designs for some of the characters, full photos from the cover shoots, a making of, and artwork based on the series. 

About the author: Christine Holbrook Landis 

Graduated from the American Musical and Dramatic Academy and also from Eastern Michigan University. Self professed book worm, seamstress,  and art lover. By day, a mild mannered ballet and ballroom dance instructor, by night a compulsive writer. Found most evenings either in the theater working on a show, sewing, singing, or in front of her computer creating worlds of words and art.

story:
We are the BAM! Toronto Youth Slam Team for 2014-2015. Our team consists of many talented poets, some of which are new to the scene and some who are seasoned champions. We are also excited to announce that we will be competing at the largest international youth poetry festival, Brave New Voices, being held in Atlanta! This is the 4th time that Toronto is being represented at Brave New Voices, and we look forward to showing the world what our city is capable of. We are also competing at YouthCanSlam - the Canadian National Youth Slam - with the intention of bringing the national championship back to Toronto. With the help of our coach Patrick De Belen, we plan on making a lot of noise this summer and to help grow the youth spoken word scene in Toronto, and even Canada as a whole! This is a dream come true for all of our poets and we would appreciate any help you can provide to help us get there!

Meet the Team:

Cassandra Myers (Captain)

Cassandra Myers has spontaneously emerged from the suburbs of the GTA as a youth spoken word artist. Her poetry is an intricate construction of her lived experience, drawing on her hard-learned lessons with heritage, sexuality, womanhood and family to create vivid imagery, getting you right in the feels. Her dedication to ever-evolving punchlines earned her the title of this year's BAM! Youth Slam Team Captain. When she is not rehearsing on subway platforms, Cassandra is taking on Toronto as a student at Ryerson University, where she takes her role on Spirit Squad to a whole other level. She loves loudly, eats constantly, and wants to be your best friend.

Matthew Robertson

Seen in the wild sporting a P-coat and headphones, Matthew Robertson is a 19 year old poet currently attending his second year of Film Studies at Ryerson University. Originally from the distant land of North Vancouver, Matthew has grown up performing at the Vancouver Poetry Slam before making his mark in Toronto. Living his life as to avid film-maker, performer, poet, and overall easy-going person; Matthew encourages that as long as you stay true to yourself, you can never go wrong. He therefore likes talking about sex, nerdism, and comic books. Go figure.

Ray Abergas 

Poet, entrepreneur and student. Ray Abergas is a 20 year old poet from Scarborough, Ontario, Canada. Hey what the captain of the 2012-2013 BTdot team, which ended up being the first ever Canadian National Youth Slam champions. Hey so what the captain of the team as well as 2013-2014 BTdot the BAM! Toronto Youth Grand Slam champion for the 2013-2014 season. He has competed at the international youth poetry festival Largest in the world, Brave New Voices.

He combines his relentless passion of helping others, poetry and performance to mold the person he is today. Ray has has traveled around north America to perform poetry, melt faces and eat good food.

Twoey Gray

Twoey Gray is a spoken word artist and pint-sized badass of despite the fact that she's never thrown a punch and cries Whenever she gets angry. She harnesses poetry as a platform for storytelling and social justice, sharing homegrown experiences of girlhood, queer identity, politics, and adventure. She is currently attending her first year at Ryerson University, studying politics and governance with a Particular interest in the non-profit sector. She is a member of Toronto's BAM! Youth team and showcases her poetry at events across the city. In her spare time, Twoey likes to explore abandoned houses and argue about Whether mermaids are real. And yes, did her actual name IS.

Lindsey Drury

As a proud member of the BAM! Toronto Youth Slam Team, Londzo AIMS to be on uncensored storyteller and professional skeptic, making it her mission to bring all things taboo out from the shadows and in front of your face. With pieces featuring piano, guitar, and ukulele, her poetry has evolved into a truly evocative experience. Besides performing poetry & music in Toronto, Londzo is currently the Issues and Ideas section editor for Glendon's bilingual newspaper, and head blogger for Lake Country Animal Hospital. (Above all, Londzo is pleasantly surprised by her ability to write in the third person of despite how uncomfortable this makes her, and hopes you'll be wincing to the irony of seeking things alongside her someday soon.)

Brian Lanigan

Brian Lanigan spends each day trying to be a better writer poetry, spoken word performer, and life experiencer. Born and raised in Toronto, Brian is currently trying to decide what he wants to be When He grows up in Montreal. Often told he is too blunt or open with strangers, Brian Attempts to leave himself vulnerable to audiences with his stories of love, resilience, and curmudgeonous cynicism. Challenging perspective is what drives Brian to write something every day, a dedication to his craft did led him to second place in the 2014 National YouthCanSlam individual grand slam, to Philidelphia where he competed at Brave New Voices, the World's Largest international poetry festival, as well as gifted him with two incredible years with the Bam! Toronto Youth Slam Team. Constantly trying to expand his view on this very confusing world, Brian hopes to take his willingness to write and his penchant for performance as far as he can and if you Would certainly appreciate came along for the ride.

Daryl (Thunderclaw) Robinson

The Living Thunder (he calls himself is what When No one is looking) Thunderclaw Robinson is a poet, actor, singer, martial artist, rapper, bare hand percussionist, instrumentalist and to avid listener of things he wants to do but can not really well yet. Attempts to recapture nostalgic childhood memories in poetry while thus questioning the world around him. Promises you he will not lie and neither will his hips. Loves romance, laughter, anime movies, video game battle themes, and hopes to make you feel some type of way with his words.

Turner Weir (Developing Poet)

Turner Weir aka T-Trilla is a rhyme-slinging spoken word artist and an emcee at heart. Hailing from the unforgivable streets of Toronto, 12-year-old Turner Weir can usually be seen confined by the suffocating bars of our education system during the day, penning classics on the back of his Grade 7 assignments. But at night, he morphs into the confident and clever T-Trilla, telling stories and rapping with the kind of skilled wordplay and wise punchlines that make people wonder if he really is from this planet, or if there is some sort of rapper/mystical sage that possesses him on stage. Still, he has a lot more growth ahead of him before he can change the face of Canadian Hip Hop, so he is building his arsenal by constantly releasing new work on his YouTube Channel, as well as working as the “Developing Poet” on the 2015 BAM! Toronto Youth Slam Team. He’s in grade 7 and spits better than your favorite rapper. That’s pretty much all you need to know for now.

The Breakdown

The $1500 that we hope to raise will go towards:

- Event Registration Fees
- Transportation
- Lodging
- Food, supplies, etc. 

Funds collected will be divided up towards the fees (registration, lodging, travel, etc.) of the following spoken word events and festivals:
- Brave New Voices: July 14-19 (Atlanta)
- Canadian Youth Nationals - YouthCanSlam: August 25-29 (Ottawa)
- And more to be announced!

The Impact

Spoken word poetry is an artform that almost anybody can do and is accessible to everyone. You don't even need a pen and paper. All you need are your thoughts. Spoken word poetry can cover any issue: race, violence, immigration, you name it. Your voice is the most powerful tool that you can ever use. As poets, we want to show youth that you can use poetry to save yourselves from the problems that you have on a daily basis. Spoken word poetry saves lives, and some of our poets are living examples of that. 

By supporting us, you're helping us show the world our voices. You're supporting a cause that is trying to change lives for the better and maybe even save a life. We are trying to raise awareness on topics that we feel aren't getting enough attention, as well as telling our stories and the stories of people who have inspired us and moved us in so many ways. 

Other Ways You Can Help

- Follow us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/groups/bamyouthslam/
- Spread the word! Word of mouth is the best way to raise awareness! 
- Check us out on Youtube! Like, comment, share, subscribe! Any help will be greatly appreciated! 
- Share this page! We can use all the help we can get!

We are also excited to announce that we will be competing at the largest international youth poetry festival, Brave New Voices, being held in Atlanta! This is the 4th time that Toronto is being represented at Brave New Voices, and we look forward to showing the world what our city is capable of. We are also competing at YouthCanSlam - the Canadian National Youth Slam - with the intention of bringing the national championship back to Toronto. With the help of our coach Patrick De Belen, we plan on making a lot of noise this summer and to help grow the youth spoken word scene in Toronto, and even Canada as a whole! story:
We are from Gaza, and we are not numbers.

That is the slogan of our project. We say it with conviction, we say it with pride, and we say it with determination. Despite the fact that reconstruction of our destroyed homes is almost nonexistent, our fishermen and farmers are regularly shot at when they try to make a living, and we still cannot travel freely, 

we will – with your help –
keep on rising up.

In February of 2015, we raised $8,500 from 136 donors around the world. It enabled us to build our website, hire a part-time project coordinator, complete training of 15 promising English writers (including paying for travel to weekly meetings and fuel for a back-up generator) and publish our first round of stories with the help of our incredible mentors. (Have you read any of them yet? Please do! We think you’ll be surprised, and as excited as we are. We’ve had pieces published now on Truthout, Middle East Eye, Mondoweiss and more. )

But more and more Gaza youth want to join, and we are already at 30! 

Our international director also has traveled to Lebanon and is partnering with an organization to help Palestinian refugees there join our project.

Please donate what you can and share this page, because

you know we aren’t numbers!

story:
Presentación (galeria videos subtítulos inglés, francés, italiano)

Soy un osteópata de Barcelona. Una día decidí junto con Raúl Navarro de Monnako Producciones y con la colaboración Paolo Bernardi, empezar un proyecto que permitiría hacer conocer mi pasión, mi forma de vida, mi trabajo. Creí que lo tenía que hacer y los medios audiovisuales eran el mejor camino.

Sentía que mucha gente en nuestro país no conocía mi profesión, la Osteopatía, ni sus beneficios para la salud. Y no podía entender porque nadie había pensado con anterioridad en realizar un documental, que además fuera una herramienta para promocionar y difundir la osteopatía como una profesión sanitaria, como en otros países.

Queremos producir este documental para las televisiones de habla inglesa, francesa, españolas y porque no, para redes sociales, con el fin de hacer pública las investigaciones científicas, sus resultados y la incongruencia legal que existe en la regulación europea de la Osteopatía, y además poner de manifiesto la situación actual a nivel académico y profesional en Europa y Estados Unidos.

Nuestra meta es presentar la Osteopatía y sus bases científicas a través de un itinerario geográfico de la historia de ésta. Para este propósito se harán entrevistas a osteópatas, investigadores, pacientes y médicos de EEUU, Inglaterra, Francia y España.

Intentamos llegar al máximo número posibles de personas para hacer realidad este innovador y útil proyecto.

Que necesitamos para hacerlo?


Los gastos en relación con los desplazamientos que se efectuarán a lo largo de todo el itinerario (sujetos a posibles variaciones) planificado será el siguiente:

-Vuelo de Barcelona a Kansas city: 1000 euros Ida x 2 ……….……..……….2000 euros

-Desplazamientos de kansas city a Kirsville: 200 euros x 2 …………………..400 euros

-Vuelos de Kansas City a London: 900 euros Ida x 2 ………………...………..1800 euros

-Vuelos de London a Paris: 50 euros Ida x 2 ……………………………….........…100 euros

- Desplazamientos en tren en Francia: 300 euros x 2 ……………..…………....600 euros

- Desplazamientos en tren en España: 150 euros  x 2 ………………………...…300 euros 

Se estima que el alojamiento tendrá un coste medio por dia de 20 euros, calculando 60 días nos da una cantidad de 1200 euros por persona, es decir, 2400 euros en total.

En cuanto a las dietas se estima que abra un coste de 15 euros por día, dando un total de 1800 euros.

Para realizar este documental el coste del equipamiento necesario se resume en lo siguiente:

- Cámara Reflex Canon 7d Full Hd ………………………...………....................…1000 euros

- Micrófono de corbata y grabadora……………………………..………..................170 euros

- Monopie con base desplegable ……………………………………….…...................58 euros

- Softbox que incluye 2 ventanas de luz para fotografia………….……............80 euros

- Disco duro externo de 2 Tb ……………………………………………......................100 euros

Será necesaria la colaboración de un técnico especialista audiovisual para la realización y postproduccion completa del documental.

El gastos se estiman en: 1500 euros

Total presupuesto……………….…………………..……………….…..….............12308 euros


Que es lo que te daremos en contrapartida?

Si colaboras con nosotros en este proyecto, a nivel personal sabrás que lo haces por algo que puede ayudar a muchas personas y al colectivo osteopático, y desde el punto de vista material te prometemos que tu nombre quedará registrado en los créditos tu colaboración. Una copia del documental será enviada a los colaboradores cuya aportación económica sea mayor de 500 euros, una vez terminada nuestra campaña de difusión pública con el documental acabado.

Colabora con nosotros!

En especial necesitamos ayuda económica para realizar este documental, pero si no puedes colaborar con nosotros económicamente, te pedimos que difundas nuestra campaña de micromecenazgo para generar un gran Eco.

No será fácil, pero todos juntos intentaremos hacerlo realidad y lo haremos!

story:
A Mother's Dreams ...

I have dreams for my children. I dream that one day my daughter will be able to tell me how she feels, what she wants, who she is. I dream she will have a friend, just one, to call her own. I dream she will have a future filled with normal things - a job, a family, security. My dreams for my son are much simpler. I dream he will be alive the day I die ...

Love, Faith, Hope, and Dreams

These are the four pillars that make up our lives, the four pillars that sustain us. Every day is a struggle. You see my daughter is autistic. I know each and every one of you think you know what this means but I can tell you, unless you are the loved one of an autistic child, you don't really have a clue. Every day is a struggle. Every moment of every day is a struggle. My daughter lives in a world, our world, that is completely foreign to her. It is too loud, too bright, too scary. Her brain is constantly inundated with unfiltered input. She is constantly overwhelmed, confused, and under immense amounts of stress. Let me help you to understand ...

Imagine yourself in the noisiest, brightest, busiest place you have ever been. Imagine you see, hear, smell, and feel everything; you cannot filter anything out. Can you feel your stress levels rising? Now imagine you can never get away from this place. Imagine you are stuck there every day and every night. This is my daughter's life.

Let's switch gears now. Imagine you are five years old. What would your biggest concerns be? The toys you want, the things you want to do, maybe a playdate with your best friend? What about the very real fear of death? What about the fear of blood work and needles and doctors and pain and sickness? This is my son's reality. He is in renal failure. His kidneys have failed once; they will fail again. Right now he should be that first little boy worried about normal things but every moment of his day is tinged by the fear of death.

This is our life. This is our reality.

How do we make it through every day? Love, Faith, Hope, and Dreams ...

  • Love - We share as much love as possible every single moment of every day of our lives.
  • Faith - We hold onto life with faith - faith that it will all work out for us, faith that we will have what we need.
  • Hope - Hope is the steadfast pillar, the one that cannot falter lest we falter with it. Without hope, we are lost.
  • Dreams - We all have our dreams. My son dreams of working for Cirque du Soliel when he grows up. My daughter dreams of "not being autistic".

Your help will mean we can begin to live our dreams. I will be able to publish our story and share with the world the power of the Four Pillars. My children will have security. This is a life-changing moment for us and we need your help.

How you can help

I am trying to raise money to self-publish my three part memoir. This requires financial seed money, money I do not have. The funds we raise will be used in five ways:

  • Books - Approximately $3500+ will be used for the first print run of the book.
  • Start-up - About $2000 will be used to establish an online presence for the books, pay for startup costs, production costs (ISBN, registrations, etc.), marketing, and any unforeseen expenses (of which I am sure there will be some of these).
  • Editing - $1000 has been budgeted for editing and converting the book to e-versions.
  • Fees and Perks - About $1500 of the money will be used to pay the fees and expenses for the campaign.
  • Charity - Any money raised beyond our needs will be donated to Give Kids the World, the Village in Orlando for sick children.

Other Ways to Help 

We know how tight money can be. Even if you cannot contribute, there are three big ways you can help us!

  • Get the word out for us! Share our campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or even face to face! This would be the best way to help us out.
  • Tell the people in your lives how much you love them. You never know when life will take them away from you. Be thankful for your what you have. I am always telling my children this. Be thankful for what you have.
  • Finally remember to Live Your Dreams!

How do we make it through every day? Love, Faith, Hope, and Dreams ...

Love - We share as much love as possible every single moment of every day of our lives.
Faith - We hold onto life with faith - faith that it will all work out for us, faith that we will have what we need.
Hope - Hope is the steadfast pillar, the one that cannot falter lest we falter with it. Without hope, we are lost.
Dreams - We all have our dreams. My son dreams of working for Cirque du Soliel when he grows up. My daughter dreams of "not being autistic".
Your help will mean we can begin to live our dreams. I will be able to publish our story and share with the world the power of the Four Pillars. My children will have security. This is a life-changing moment for us and we need your help.
How you can help
I am trying to raise money to self-publish my three part memoir. This requires financial seed money, money I do not have. The funds we raise will be used in five ways:

Books - Approximately $3500+ will be used for the first print run of the book.
Start-up - About $2000 will be used to establish an online presence for the books, pay for startup costs, production costs (ISBN, registrations, etc.), marketing, and any unforeseen expenses (of which I am sure there will be some of these).
Editing - $1000 has been budgeted for editing and converting the book to e-versions.
Fees and Perks - About $1500 of the money will be used to pay the fees and expenses for the campaign.
Charity - Any money raised beyond our needs will be donated to Give Kids the World, the Village in Orlando for sick children.
Other Ways to Help 

We know how tight money can be. Even if you cannot contribute, there are three big ways you can help us!

Get the word out for us! Share our campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or even face to face! This would be the best way to help us out.
Tell the people in your lives how much you love them. You never know when life will take them away from you. Be thankful for your what you have. I am always telling my children this. Be thankful for what you have.
Finally remember to Live Your Dreams!

story:
AMREKIE!

An Impractical Travel Guide
And Musings On Being An American Working In The Arab World.

An impractical travel guide you say?

My name is Jarrod Wilson and I had the strange fortune to spend the last several years working for a Saudi Prince. Crazy, I know, right. During that time I traveled to 11 countries and discovered a world of international business that was a dizzing mix of traditional values and modernity. I want to share the trials and errors (ok mostly errors) that I experienced along the way. Part travel guide, part misadventure story, I plan to write a pocket guide for the Arabian traveler as only a midwestern American boy could. This is the book I WISH I would have had. I will provide vital information and humerous stories from my own experiences.

You don't need to travel from your own comfortable chair to take this adventure with me. I will explore Islam, international business, common mistakes, customs issues, resolving conflict, security concerns and when to just let it all go.

It will be a great adventure and I invite you take it with me. I hope to be there with you, in your bag, when things get interesting.

Help me to help other travelers.

What I hope to accomplish with this campaign:

  • Fund the final editing of the content
  • Produce a limited 500 edition print run of the book
  • If I don't reach my goal I plan to release a digital only version

Bringing understanding with humor.

One of my biggest discoveries was just how little these two cultures understand about each other. I am hoping, in a humerous way of bridging the divide even just a little, while providing invaluable tips for the traveler. 

I appreciate your support and look forward to sharing some great stories with you, and if I help you along the way with your own travels well then, hamdullah.

story:
I have a story to tell or maybe quite a few, so I wrote this book. 


It's a true story of my mom and I and it begins when I meet her after a long separation at the age of eleven. She was a heroin addict who suffered from mental illness and this is the story of my longing for her to be something else until the day she died and I realized the perfection of exactly what she was. 


There are plenty of salacious tales along the way of our lives that while often estranged, were always connected. 


It's not easy to describe what an entire book is about but to throw a couple of ideas at you, there's plenty of promiscuity, some incarceration, lots of drugs, heartbreak, some boxed wine, self-loathing, intense loneliness, international stripping and of course, yearning for nothings and nobodies. 


In very non-traditional ways, my mother taught me everything I know, which may be nothing at all but I'll let you be the judge. 


I intend to reach readers who, like me, have felt alone with the intensity of their sadness and who have craved people that devastate them. I would be audacious and actually quite stupid to say that I have overcome the dark places entirely but with humor and relatability, maybe someone reading will feel connected and less like jumping off the nearest bridge. 


The money I am raising is to firstly pay for an editor. I have chosen Shari Goldhagen in NY. She comes highly recommended and I am excited to get started with the polishing process.


From there, I intend to do an e-book conversion and start selling that, so that I can go to agents with a book that is already making progress and drum up the kind of interest a first-time author has a very hard time doing otherwise. 


I would like to hire a publicist as well, to help with this process so that my Facebook friends don't all delete me with the irritation that being bombarded with shameless self-promotion induces. 


Your help and sharing of this link fills me with gratitude that shakes my core. This has been a dream of mine for a very long time and watching it come into fruition totally rocks my world! 



Thank-you!

story:
The Book

We've come to a crossroads in human history. We either willingly support each other and our planet, or we are forced to support elitist institutions, our own slavery, and ultimately our own destruction. I wish to put my talents of researching, reporting and writing into the service of convincing humanity to travel the first road, not the second. by writing a book because once the rebellion succeeds, we must face the task of building a better society,


The working title of my book is: After Occupation: Creating Prosperity & Sustainability for All. The book would do three things: 1) EXPLAIN why contemporary Western industrial economics, whether capitalist or socialist, CAN'T work for us, because of structural problems that are not solvable by greater personal responsibility, by the establishment and recognition of employment as a human right, or by voting in another faction. One such structural problem, the competitive job market, is detailed in my video; 2) DESCRIBE some alternatives from historical and current indigenous practices e.g. gift economies, and alternatives currently in place in contemporary Western societies e.g. local currencies; and 3)  SUGGEST some of the questions we need to ask e.g. what is wealth? and values we need to develop, e.g. cooperation over competition, in order transform these historical examples and contemporary small-scale experiments into fully operational communities worldwide.

The Author

I'm Kellia Ramares-Watson, a 56-year-old independent writer and radio producer from Oakland, California. I've worked a wide variety of jobs in my day: full-time, part-time, through temp agencies and direct hire, for a solo entrepreneur and for large corporations. At least five corporations for which I have worked no longer exist, including two that were very proud to have never laid off anyone during the Great Depression. I have even tried my own hand at small business by stringing tennis rackets, reading astrology charts and most recently, by producing news stories and public affairs programs for radio stations and websites.

I have a BA in Economics from Fordham University in New York, and thus was trained in the rigorous analytical methods for which the Jesuits are famous. I was, in my youth, a political activist in traditional party politics. I am currently a "decline to state" voter who is a member of two international email lists that discuss the gift economy and demonetization (the abolition of monetary systems).  I've known what it's like to default on student loans because college was a hindrance to getting a job. I've known what it's like to declare bankruptcy, to go to a food bank, and to be seriously ill (2 strokes and a heart attack) without health insurance. I have seen the profession of journalism self-destruct as both a way to protect our democracy and a way for me to pay the bills. In short, my entire life has been a preparation for writing this book.

The Impact

The Occupy Movement and the upcoming US Presidential election makes NOW the time to focus on completing the book, so that the ideas and examples in it can be a part of the discussion on the shape of the world going forward. Despite furious opposition, more people seem open as never before to the idea that we just CAN'T continue in the same vein much longer.

I don't claim to be any kind of genius or Messiah; I'm a journalist whose personal and professional experiences put me in a position to present facts, questions and ideas, my own and others', into a vital discussion of what to do to replace this ever-deteriorating economic and political situation of permanent war, destruction of civil liberties and ecological decline.

As I have searched for venues at which to speak on alternative economics, I have discovered that it takes a book to really grab people's attention. Even if they don't actually read it, people will automatically assume the author of a book has a certain gravitas that is matched perhaps only by a maker of feature-length documentaries. No matter how many radio interviews I produce or articles that I write for various web sites, the fact remains that I can get more speaking engagements, more journalists to interview me, and more people who would be willing to be interviewed by me for future projects on point if I were the author of a book.

Already, a local Internet radio host, who was referred to me by a colleague, disappeared after I told him that my book would not be out until sometime next year. He was looking for an imminent release, a "news hook" on which he could peg an interview. All news, and most public affairs shows, are built around events rather than ideas per se. A book release is such an event. The special events coordinator of a local community radio station told me he picked speakers by perusing lists of books that had recently been released. There are many book stores in the San Francisco Bay Area that host speaking events, but of course, they want the event to be in connection with a book release.

Why Indie-go-go instead of a traditional publisher?"

"Be the change you want to see in the world" Gandhi

Traditional publishers represent the old top-down economic paradigm that needs replacing.

1) Permission needed from the powers that be. Most publishers these days do not welcome an unsolicited manuscript. You have to write a query or proposal to their specifications first.

2) Elitism.  Some publishers will not consider your manuscript unless you have an agent.

3) Rationing and competition for existence. A proposal may not be accepted because the publisher has only time and resources enough to publish X number of books per year. Modern self-publishing technology means that the act of publishing is not a competitive process.  The opportunity for the book to exist does not depend on a decision made by a few strangers seeking to profit from another person's work.

4) Labor exploitation. Since editors who develop new writers are in museum collections with dodos and passenger pigeons, and authors must do market research, present camera-ready copy, and all but A-list authors must arrange their own book tours, I wonder what publishers do these days besides collecting the lion's share of the proceeds and leaving the author with a very small fraction of the price of each book sold. A friend in the industry says their job is to do the three-martini lunch with their peers.

5) Large ecological and economic footprint.  I plan self-publish in hard copy with an "on-demand" Internet-based publisher so that no trees are wasted printing books that are not sold. (The "hard copy" option benefits people who do not want to read online. The hard copy is also a better archive). I also plan to release an e-book version that will not involve the costs of paper, ink and postage, thus making a less expensive option accessible to a broad base.  
 
6) Practicalities. Traditional publishers cannot put a book out in less than a year from acceptance of a proposal. I want After Occupation out by mid 2012 so that there is time to inject its contents into the US election season. The more I have immersed myself in this subject, the more I find that there is to learn. In order to write more than a personal screed against the way things are, I need the project to be a full time job because there are books to read, .mp3s to listen to, lectures to attend, people to interview, and even pictures to take.  The smaller publishers that might be interested in this topic by a first-time book author do not offer advances.

What I Need & What You Get

I am asking the community to crowdfund me an "advance" of $6300, a sum that will meet basic expenses in the pricey San Francisco Bay Area for three months plus the admin fees of both Indie go-go and Pay Pal. The purpose of an advance is to help an author meet basic expenses while working full time on a book.

The list of premiums you can get is in the sidebar.

The Best Ways You Can Help

Please pre-order the book, or order any other premium, and urge your friends to do likewise, by PayPal because PayPal funds come to us immediately, whereas direct credit card is paid to us only at the end of the campaign. Also, a payment sent straight from your checking account to PayPal avoids credit card interest for you!

story:
Hi! My name is Sally.

I am a young adult novelist from Cape Town, South Africa.

My second novel, Fuse, which deals with the sensitive subjects of school killings, bullying and runaways, has been selected as Ibby South Africa’s English nomination for the Ibby International Honour Roll and will be showcased at the Ibby World Congress in August 2012.

What this means is that my book is going to be showcased along with many other international titles, which is a phenomenal opportunity for my work to be exposed to the international market.

I'd love to be able to attend the conference myself, meet my overseas peers and network with the English children's book industry.

More importantly, I'd love to be able to walk up on that stage in person to accept my Honour Roll certifcate.

Now here's where YOU come in.

August is only four months away. There's no way I'll be able to come up with the money in time for a plane ticket. Besides, the conference takes place days after the Olympics, so prices will be ridiculous.

Please help me raise the money for a plane ticket. (Its cheaper if I fly via Dubai, but still out of my reach).

As I'm sure you can imagine, this is a dream come true.

If you can't spare the cash then I also need....

Accommodation!
Advice on how to get around London
Anyone you think would be able to help me.

story:
¿Qué?

El aprendiz aborda esos grandes dilemas a los que siempre, tarde o temprano, debemos enfrentarnos en busca de lo más importante en la vida: la felicidad.

Berta, una mujer actual e independiente, tendrá que optar entre renunciar a su sueño más oculto, o lanzarse a lo desconocido en busca del amor verdadero. Una historia emocionante y romántica, que juega con los sentimientos y la aventura, donde los personajes buscarán su lugar y su momento.

Desde la nostálgica Coruña hasta la cálida Valencia, pasando por el vibrante Boston del siglo pasado. Una historia que hará que el lector se pregunte cuánto hay de realidad, y cuánto de fantasía.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Marian Espinosa.

Nacida en 1976, en Cocentaina, al norte de la provincia de Alicante, ha sido fiel a su gente y a sus metas. Estudió Derecho en la Universidad de Alicante y desde hace más de diez años ejerce como abogada, en su localidad natal, que nunca quiso abandonar; y, ello, a pesar de haber perdido la vista, sentido este que ha cambiado por una voluntad inquebrantable para alcanzar aquello que desea.

Con El aprendiz está a punto de conseguir otro sueño, el ser escritora, algo que ha llevado dentro desde siempre, y que ahora quiere compartir con todos sus lectores. Ojalá, éste pueda ser el inicio de otro sueño, de otra meta alcanzada, gracias a todos los que ahora apoyáis esta campaña.

Marian Espinosa te emocionará.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 700€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El aprendiz que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Marian Espinosa vea publicada su obra. 

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes 
ideas como es el crowdfunding. De este modo eres tú, 
ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra 
que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro 
catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.Hoy te presentamos a Marian Espinosa.
Nacida en 1976, en Cocentaina, al norte de la provincia de
Alicante, ha sido fiel a su gente y a sus metas. Estudió Derecho en la
Universidad de Alicante y desde hace más de diez años ejerce como abogada, en
su localidad natal, que nunca quiso abandonar; y, ello, a pesar de haber perdido
la vista, sentido este que ha cambiado por una voluntad inquebrantable para
alcanzar aquello que desea.
Con El aprendiz está a punto de conseguir otro
sueño, el ser escritora, algo que ha llevado dentro desde siempre, y que ahora
quiere compartir con todos sus lectores. Ojalá, éste pueda ser el inicio de
otro sueño, de otra meta alcanzada, gracias a todos los que ahora apoyáis esta
campaña.
Marian Espinosa te emocionará.¿Cómo?Para
 arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 700€; esta es la 
cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con 
un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El aprendiz que saldría pocas semanas 
después a la venta.Además... Sabemos
 que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible 
que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en 
estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, 
incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta 
campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Marian Espinosa vea publicada su obra. Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Minding the Gap

Life Between the Pages

 I am a writer and a Vajrayana Buddhist practitioner. In the Nyingma -- or "Ancient School" -- of Buddhism, the term "Dzogchen" represents the culmination of the Buddhist path, and the ultimate final teaching of the Buddha. This esoteric tradition takes the most ordinary and common reality of our human existence as its basis, and is therefore accessible to all, because it encompasses all.  Thus, the ground of Dzogchen is simply experience, devoid of narrative or construct, and the path of the practitioner involves two concepts: 1) Trekcho, or the "cutting through” and 2) Thogal, the "passing over the summit” or the "direct crossing."  These teachings represent not only my spiritual path, but also provide a powerful metaphor for my present life, and the foundation for my Indiegogo campaign.

Trekcho: Cutting Through, Cutting Away

In December 2011, I took retreat alone for nearly two weeks, on a ranch in Georgia. Each day I rode horses. I rode in the rain, the sleet, the cold wind, a few days under a hot sun, and I wrote.  I wrote page after page, and in so doing, I examined my life.  I made some decisions.  Decisions to cut through false ideas of self and the identity to which I was clinging, and to let many material things go in order to make some room – create a gap, so to speak – so that I could devote my life to a more authentic path.  Generally, I desired a journey of body, mind and experience.  More specifically, I longed for a much simpler life of writing, travel, teaching yoga, returning to a meditation practice, and horses.  Yes, horses. 

In the space I created – in the gap between what was and what could be – three incredible opportunities arose: 

1. To teach yoga and offer workshops, in a lovely space, on a beautiful   island, closer to the teachers with whom I want to study and deepen my skills;  

2. To receive lessons and training in natural horsemanship, and be exposed to a gifted teacher and horses year round, in a positive setting;  and

3. To deepen my Buddhist practice via an intensive three year foundational program of study in the lineage that inspires me most deeply, most profoundly.

In order to honor these opportunities, I set a date for departure from a place I love and have called home for many years. I lightened my load by donating and gifting many possessions. I also significantly simplified my life and lowered my living expenses.  I raised money by selling nearly everything else I own, teaching and consulting. But the funds I have raised are not enough to cover my estimated expenses for the first year of this transition.  In my many years of offering pro bono and volunteer service, and fundraising for organizations, I learned an important lesson.  Yes, you must identify the need, and tell the story, openly and honestly.  But that is not enough.  You must also ask:  ask for assistance, ask for help, ask for funding. 

And then trust.  Just trust. 

Thogal: Crossing Over the Summit

With your support, if I am able to reach my $5000 goal, nearly 1/3 of the following costs will be covered in the next year:

1. Significant travel and relocation expenses to Orcas Island, Washington, and additional travel expenses to hatha yoga and Buddhist retreats, trainings and workshops in Colorado and California;

2. Registration costs and fees for horsemanship, yoga and Buddhist lessons, retreats, trainings, and workshops in Washington, Colorado and California; and

3. Upgrades to my current technology so that I can better record it all, and use these experiences, this new path, as the basis for a new writing project. 

The Ultimate Realization

Nothing of merit in my life has come without the unwavering generosity, support and love of close and long-term friends, and from the Key West community and our “One Human Family.”  Nothing.  I woke up one of those rainy Georgia mornings in the winter of 2011, and realized that the whole of life is nothing less than a love story. Between birth and death there is also a gap, a space, and everything in it – not just the pleasant experiences but also the painful ones, not just a single relationship but all of them, not just a job or a career but the entire mix of leisure and work and creative passion – is part of the story.  An incredible love story I hope to share with others through my teaching, my practice, and my craft. 

Will you help me write the next chapter? 

I would be so grateful.  Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Poetry is my life. It is my way of connecting with other people, reminding myself that I am not alone. It is also my therapy.

I've spent much of the past year and a half building the slam poetry scene in Rockford, Illinois, a city that knows very little about the art form.

This work has included:

  • teaching elementary and high schoolers about the meaning of slam poetry
  • working one-on-one with new slam poets to better their stage presence
  • hosting open mics at a local coffee shop, and working with the owner of another local shop in order to put on the city's first monthly poetry slam since 2005.
After investing so much time in behind-the-scenes work, I now feel the need to focus on my own poetry.
 
My personal goal for 2013 is to do the following:
  • travel to poetry slams west of the Mississippi in order to meet new poets, and see new poetry scenes (I'd like to make stops in Idaho, Colorado, Oregon, Washington, and California)
  • bring back experience and knowledge to Rockford, IL to help make the poetry scene here stronger 
I am planning on taking several months off from my job this summer to travel and perform poetry and need to raise some money to make this trip possible.
 

My Credentials 

For information on me, the poet:
 
http://garciapoetry.com (website)
http://facebook.com/GarciaPoetry (Facebook fan page)
http://youtube.com/GarciaPoetry (YouTube channel)
 

What I Need 

In order to accomplish this goal, I will need to take time off work. This presents some special challenges because I have type 1 diabetes that costs me approx. $150 every month in medical prescriptions.

My estimate for the amount of money I need to raise is $2,500 for a three month trip. This money would cover:

  • medical prescriptions for type 1 diabetes ($450 for three months)
  • phone bill ($150 for three months)
  • Greyhound bus fare ($243 to Rexburg, $179 from Rexburg to Denver, $188 from Denver to Bellingham, $50 from Bellingham to Portland, $94 from Portland to San Francisco, $250 for return fare to Illinois)
  • food, etc. ($225 for three months)
  • lodging ($500 to cover any places couch surfing isn't available)

If my entire fundraising goal is not met, I will put all my money raised to the same use, I just may not travel as far as I anticipated.

The Impact

I really feel like this project will not only benefit myself, but also my home poetry scene.

I believe that this trip will help many Rockford poets in the long run. My aim is that by taking a break from organizing and hosting events, I can return to Rockford and feel newly energized about creating/running events and helping other poets better their craft.

I've been feeling very burnt out on my local scene. This trip is necessary to help me overcome that feeling.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially contribute, you can still help me out!

  • spread the word about my project by linking people to this page
  • use the share tools!

Thank you for your consideration. :)
