story:
“Amalek.

They left to save Israel. They landed in hell”

 www.amalek-novel.com

Short Summary

My name is Thibault Verbiest and I am a Belgian born author.

I was an attorney-at-law for 20 years, heading a well-known internet law firm established in Paris, Brussels and Tel-Aviv .

After a burn-out that left me exhausted, I decided to radically change my lifestyle and to dedicate the second part of my life to causes and challenges that are more aligned with my true inner values. I am now an executive and team coach, a web entrepreneur (e.g. a crowd funding platform) and a novelist.

My literary voyage began on a sunny Saturday of May 2008. I was biking in a disused Racecourse of a verdant commune in Brussels when, suddenly, an idea struck me, like a whispered breath, a crazy writing project.” Israeli soldiers being teleported to the Auschwitz concentration camp”.

I immediately felt the power of this simple idea. I was captivated. The need to tell this impossible story became irresistible. With passion, I immersed myself in dozens of books, films and online material about Judaism, Holocaust, quantum physics, Kabbalah, the subtleties of the Arab-Israeli conflict, and many other topics. Sometimes I felt stuck and overwhelmed by the complexity of certain subjects, then something unexpectedly happened, a providential helping hand, a synchronicity, an almost miraculous encounter, an inspiring coincidence. Like a colonel of Tsahal (Israeli army) who sat "by chance" next to me in a bar of an international hotel in Brussels ... Or a former ambassador of Israel who showed up in front of me in a train heading for Paris, after I I uttered his name the day before ...

Three years later I was writing the word “end” on Amalek.

Like most French-speaking writers I sent my manuscript to several publishing houses in Paris and eventually I found my publisher a few blocks away from where I live, in Waterloo, in the South suburbs of Brussels…

After a year of (successful) distribution in the French-speaking countries and on Amazon, I decided it was time to address the Anglo-Saxon world. Unfortunately we found rejection from most literary agents and publishing houses  due mostly to my lack of having an established name in UK or US…

So I decided to take matters into my own hands and to begin Indie publishing my book in English (the first 7 chapters are already available in English, see chapter 1 below).

In the meantime I have a lot of books to write and several projects to work on such as this one.

What people are saying about Amalek

The book has been very well received in Belgium and Paris, both by the general public and the press (see my website www.thibaultverbiest.eu and http://www.amazon.fr/Amalek-mission-sauver-Israël-destination/dp/2930627514). More importantly, I received special acknowledgments from Holocaust survivors who were moved and impressed by the realistic and sincere description of the daily life of the prisoners, as well as the resistance organizations, within the Birkenau camp.

 Many readers were also touched by the spirit of unity that blows through the work, between the sons of Abraham, the quest of my life, contributing somehow to the reconciliation of the children of the Holy Scriptures, Christians, Jews, and Muslims.

Thibault Verbiest guides the reader with pedagogy into the meanders of Sufism, the Final Solution or quantum physics. Written with the expertise of a veteran by a debut novelist... in short, this is a book you should hear about .

Yves Thiran, journalist (RTBF, Belgian Public Television)

A completely exciting and innovative fiction novel, mixing up with talent history, geopolitical, physics quantum and Kabbalah... A powerful story, a solid mastery of style and writing.. A reference of its kind, no doubt.

Sylvie Bensaid, journalist (Tribune Juive, Paris)

I just closed the last page of Amalek and I must confess I have loved this book.. By building bridges between peoples, you show that the Universal is the goal and therefore your book will remain remembered. I found in your fast and above all excellently documented narrative style the style  that I loved in Dominique Lapierre and Larry Collins books....

Armand Broder, Belgian-Israeli lawyer

 

Synopsis of “Amalek” (700.000 characters)

In a Middle East in chaos, a fringe ultra-extremist Muslim Brotherhood sect takes control of an underground military complex located in Mount Sinai Egypt, where three portable atomic bombs are stored, ready for use.

Hassan Al-Dawar, at the head of this fanatic group, has teamed up with U.S. General William Quaker, who is under the influence of charismatic televangelist Terry Gere, in a common vision to precipitate the End of Days. Al-Dawar and Pastor Gere both believe they have received a divine mission to hasten the parousia, Christ's return, a prelude to the advent of the Millennium.

To fulfill the prophecy, an atomic bomb must explode in Iran. Tehran will be convinced that the State of Israel is responsible for this attack and will have no choice but to retaliate by detonating a nuclear warhead at Megiddo.

Operation “Holy Return” has begun.

The sword of King David is stolen from the Topkapi Palace and the attack is disguised so as to suggest the involvement of the Israeli army. A nuclear plant in Iran is hacked by a virus whose code includes references to the Book of Esther, and the web is flooded with fake secret messages announcing the imminent destruction of the Shiite enemy and calling on Jews worldwide not to go to Iran.

The plot reaches the Mossad and an emergency commando raid is mounted. The soldiers of the elite unit Matkal are trapped and all members are killed.

A national crisis meeting is convened in Jerusalem. The Prime Minister recommends the use of nuclear weapons to destroy the Mount Sinai base but Beirach David, from Mossad, offers an alternative - to attempt an unprecedented operation: teleporting a commando to the Egyptian base using experimental quantum technology developed by the Research Institute Weizmann.

The machine is a revolutionary type of particle collider conceived to create wormholes, tunnels in space-time. The work of the Institute is based on research carried out by Professor Bakal, a Jewish scholar who was detained at a secret base in Siberia and who was able to smuggle, through a quantum computer, the plans of the machine before he was killed.

Beirach David is responsible for leading operation "Amalek" and has ten days to succeed. His first task is to recruit the nine soldiers of the commando. All are selected on the basis of mysterious kabbalistic criteria transmitted by Professor Bakal.

Four women are part of the commando: commander Leah Ben Gibor, a cold and cruel killer of Mossad; Sarah Shabtaï, a pacifist pro-Palestinian reporter; Iris Lahad , a beautiful and reckless Yemeni married to a religious Zionist; and Noam Melech, a lawyer of Ethiopian origin.

The five men who complete the commando are just as eclectic: the arrogant Nathan Weisz, the son of a wealthy industrialist; Hussein Jibril, the rebel Druze; the intrepid Dr. Yuri Krassota; Tomer Haniel the kibbutznik, a paraplegic with an experimental exoskeleton; and Yankel Gnod, the soldier of God.

After ten days of intensive training at a secret base in the Negev desert, Operation Amalek commences and the commando is teleported…but the destination is not the one intended. They land a few miles away from Auschwitz in October 1943, without knowing  why, and apparently without any possibility of return.

With the help of a Polish general they manage to extract from a neighboring camp, they hatch a plan to coordinate an uprising in the camp of Birkenau.

The nine Israeli soldiers break into the camp of Birkenau and, through a network of Polish resistance, are assigned to strategic positions within the camp: Iris in Kanada, the area where the goods of the deportees are stored, Tomer in the Sonderkommando (crematoria), Yuri at the camp hospital, Leah becomes Kapo (a trustee inmate who supervises the prisoners) in the "barracks of French women,” Hussein in the kitchen of the camp of gypsies, Noam becomes a Jehovah's Witness and works in the villa of an SS commander, while Yankel is a truck driver. Nathan and Sarah are disguised as SS. 

An initiatory journey to the heart of hell starts for the members of the Israeli commando.

Maximilian Grabner, head of the Gestapo camp, has made it his mission to hunt down and eliminate the elite unit. The tension never ceases as he is constantly at their heels, a breath away from succeeding in their capture.

The day of the revolt is planned for the first night (Erev) of Yom Kippur - the Day of Atonement.

Our nine heroes discover that each is predestined and linked to one of the spheres (sephira) of the Tree of Kabbalah. This revelation transforms them as they learn who they really are and their biblical destiny.

They will then return to save their world and Iran. And enable the emergence of a new era…

 

What I Need & What You Get

Here's what I need the money for, in order of importance (that is, order in which they will get funded depending on how much money I receive):

  • A professional translation of my novel into English.

  • Proofreading - making sure those pesky typos don't make it into the final product!

  • Ebook conversion - paying for professional conversion to ensure the best reading experience for digital readers. Multimedia content will be added to the ebook that does not exist in the current French physical book.

  • Marketing campaign including sending out free digital copies to libraries across the US/UK and digital and postcard campaigns.

  • Press kits to send out along with review copies of the novel to as many reviewers as possible.

You'll see to the right what you'll get at each level, but here is a brief description of the various prizes available:

·         Digital copy of Amalek 

  • ·         Hard copy of Amalek

  • ·         Your name in the special thanks both in the ebook and printed version of the book

  • ·         Your name as supporter in at the end of the future movie “Amalek”

Your impact

The “duty of memory” is a growing necessity as the last Shoa survivors will soon disappear. Memory is not maintained only by history books. We must use the language and the means of communication of the younger generations. The digital novel is a manner to talk to young people. The Holocaust is also a universal tragedy and must be a place of memory for all, whatever their culture. By helping to finance the English version of Amalek, you contribute also to my mission, building bridges between cultures and uniting peoples for a better, more tolerant and more caring world.

The English book will be also an added value for the movie “Amalek” as producers are already interested in the story. A script is now being written and my Belgian producer (http://panacheproductions.be/  ) is willing to team up with US producers to make it happen !   

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also be a great contributor by helping to get the word out about my campaign via blog, FB, twitter, email, and the Indiegogo website share tools to groups and individuals you think might invest. I appreciate you spreading the word to anyone you can think of. Maybe a New York based publishing house or literary agent;-)


Chapter 1

 

 

On a meadow caressed by a cold dry wind leafy saplings danced in a synchronised waltz.

Nature had been frozen into a deathly coldness by the early winter, and under a lowering grey sky nothing seemed to move in a lifeless calm except for the rustling of some dry grass.

 

Suddenly, a cry pierced the icy air and shadows moved in the sleeping stillness.

“Regroup, quickly!”

In a flash, four men and four women in combat outfits grouped themselves in a star shaped formation. Hunkered down and with rifles pointing outward like a giant hedgehog, they identified themselves one at a time. “Tomer’s missing,” exclaimed Hussein, his eyes fixed on the horizon.

 

Before this strange assembly could catch its breath, a familiar muffled noise, like the crackling of a faulty loud speaker, was heard.

In a split second, the mouth of a silver sphere suspended in the air a few metres from the commando began to grow, curving outwards. A familiar silhouette appeared from nowhere.

The number seven, Tomer Hamiel, found himself face to face with his comrades stupefied by his apparition. And yet, only a few moments before, the same thing had happened to them!

-          “Commander, where are we?” stammered Tomer.

-          “No idea” came the reply, “but for God’s sake, keep calm. Concentrate and go to stealth mode”.

By a recognition system of the Iris, and pre-defined movements of the eyes and eyelids, the inter-active menu flashed up the chameleon function on the virtual screen in the helmet of the commando members.

Instantly, they merged into their surroundings of a green field the size of a football pitch surrounded by trees. Sarah Chabtaï mouthed into the microphone of her helmet:

-          “Nathan you built this crap machine, say something!”

From the male point of view, Sarah was a smiling, smartly dressed, typical blond.

No one could guess that an expert in counter terrorism and eventual pacific reporter, was hidden behind her freckled baby face.

Nathan Weisz, the last minute replacement, viewed as a dandy, brilliant maybe but infatuated and arrogant, replied slowly and gravely trying to keep his temper.

-           “The only thing about which I’m certain is that we’re not in that god damned Egyptian base. Leah, we have to get under cover in the trees, and work out what’s going on”.

With a brief gesture of his head, Leah Ben Gibor the unit commander directed the members of the squadron towards the NorthWest and the nearest trees.

With mankind’s inbred instinct to try and hide in a hostile environment, they all headed to the thickest clump of trees. Leaning against a solid birch tree in the midst of some pines, the Commander, Leah Ben Gibor activated his personal PC to check the onboard communications system linking the members of the commando.

-          “No GPS or satellite signal was online. Incomprehensible! We’ll have to try a radio scan” cut in Nathan, who’d been responsible for communications in Tsanhanim, the special parachutists unit.

He switched on and after a few seconds picked up some distant poor quality music.

-          “Sounds like a waltz” murmured Nathan. “Keep looking” was the sharp retort from Captain Hussein Jibril, second in rank and deputy leader.

There was a jumble of voices and suddenly an audible conversation.

-          “Am I dreaming or is that a Slavic language?” muttered Nathan. “Yuri, do you understand anything of this babbling?”.

In his helmet with holographic images on the visor, Doctor Yuri Krassota strained to hear.

-          “Wait, I’m not sure, can’t hear very well, but, yes it’s Polish!”. 

Yuri Krassota was far away the oldest and most experienced of the commando. Ex military doctor in the Spetsnaz of the Russian army, he had emigrated to Israel seven years earlier.

Not without a certain amount of difficulty, he had managed to be accepted into the very respected 669 unit devoted to search and rescue operations of wounded soldiers in enemy territory, or survivors of nature’s catastrophes.

Fearless, indeed suicidal, said some, Yuri was decorated for saving a little girl in Haiti, trapped under tons of debris about to collapse any minute in the aftermath of the 2010 earthquake.

Lieutenant Yankel Gnod, third in rank, broke the puzzled silence to intone, “the Rabbi warned us before we left that God would not let our arrogance go unpunished. He’s testing us and”…. 

A forceful “Shut up” was the response of the commander Leah Ben Gibor.

-          “These comments are helping no one. We need to get on. Let’s find somewhere civilized and we’ll soon get some answers”.

With a comforting gesture, sergeant Noam Melekh, his frail ebony face seemingly floating in an oversized helmet, discretely took hold of the wrist of Yankel who was smiling weakly.

There was a world of difference between Commander Leah Ben Gibor, an angry Zionist and Yankel Gnod, a kid from Mea Shearim, the ultra-orthodox Jewish quarter of Jerusalem.   

Leah couldn’t stop himself from seeing as stooges these men dressed in black caftans called Haredim, literally “the God fearers” wearing beards and paper curlers in the image of their central European ancestors.

However, Yankel had cut all ties to his domestic origins which rejected all legitimacy of the State of Israel, in awaiting the return of the Messiah, the only one according to their beliefs who could restore Zion.

Leah had read the dossier of Yankel and was aware of the journey, which had seen him land in a unit of the Kfir brigade composed exclusively of religious Zionist soldiers and officers.

Captain Jibril, the only Druze in the commando, lectured his troops:

-          “Move as we did in training.  Each of you in his sector; first assault group on my left. Second on my right. Command in front. Move forward cautiously to the edge of the wood. Above all, keep a sharp lookout with your motion sensors”.

After a dozen or so minutes the brush became less dense, and the soldiers began to see a glimmer of light through the thick curtain of pines.

The right iris of Leah flickered, prompting multiple instructions on his virtual screen.

-          “A field with fencing. The area’s inhabited. A building at 300 metres. It looks like a farm”. “I see three targets” continued Yankel in sniper position, his HK 417 rifle firmly wedged in the hollow of his right shoulder.

Without a second’s thought Leah carried on, “Yuri and Iris go! Yankel and the others cover them”.

Yuri made a rapid sign to with his right hand to Iris, whose barely visible elongated face and pouting lips, betrayed an exotic mixture of Middle East and Asia, as was often the case with Israelis of Yemenite origin.

He grabbed his Tavor assault rifle and headed the expedition towards the mysterious and distant farm.

-          “Iris, you only activate stealth mode on my order. We have to economize our energy reserves as long as we can’t make sense of this mess”.

Adjutant Iris Lahad silently agreed, but at the same time carefully checking the technical information provided in real time by her onboard digital communication system.

Arriving at the level of the stable, first building adjoining the North face of the principal structure, the two soldiers paused to take stock of the situation.

-          “The stable is empty, the owner must have taken the cattle out to pasture in a neighbouring field” whispered Yuri.

They surreptitiously enter the main part of the living quarters of the building, lower down the courtyard along the south side.

Behind the house an orchard gave way to open fields rising towards the surrounding hills. Yuri goes in first.  In front of him he finds a spacious kitchen with a large and heavy fireplace in white Carrera marble.

The room was empty but the motion sensor indicates three people in the next room, no doubt the dining room or living room. Yuri calmly signals with his right hand index finger the direction to take.

And with a murmur, “gently, on three we go”. Without a sound the soldiers burst into the main living room where a mother was serving some cakes to two children of between four and six years, sitting quietly with their white bibs tied around their necks.

The terrorized mistress of the house, drops her tray which smashes on the floor whilst Yuri dashes over to prevent her from screaming. Just as quickly, Iris tries to reassure the children calling to their mother with terrified cries.

-          “Please, don’t cry, we’re friends. You understand Russian don’t you?” What’s your name” hastily said Yuri in his native tongue, forcing a smile. 

With a trembling voice the mother replies Katrina.

-          “ Katrina, tell me where we are. What’s the name of this place?”

-           “Rajsko “

-          “ What’s the nearest town”? 

-          “Jaworzno 

Yuri is lost in thought.

Iris asks in a questioning voice, which can’t hide her anxiety, “what’s happening? Where are we?

-          « We’re well and truly in Poland. I must advise the others by radio. >

 

The rest of the group arrives a few minutes later and an improvised camp is set up in the main body of the building. The Polish mother and her children remain seated around the table of the dining room under the watchful eye of Iris who tries to distract the younger of the two children with some simple magic tricks.

Taking off his helmet, Yuri began his briefing to a shaky audience.

-          “If I’ve understood his wife correctly, the owner of this place is being held in a prison not far from here.The farm seems to be isolated so therefore we should be out of harm’s way”.

-          “Did she say anything else” calmly asked Sarah Chabtai shaking her blond hair free from her helmet.

-          “She clammed up when she saw the Star of David on the pendant of Iris around her neck. As if she’d seen the devil in person”.

In a learned tone Nathan added, “It’s profound polish Catholicism which still believes Jews poison the wells and performs sacrificial rites on children”.

Leah curtly broke off the dialogue.

-          “On the south side there’s a local road leading to a path. Yankel and Nathan check it out. As quick as you can, see if you can throw some light on this crazy situation. As we know nothing of where we are, Be very careful, safety first!”

Yankel and Nathan advanced cautiously for about 20 minutes before the country path gave way to a macadam road.

The two soldiers activated the stealth mode of their suits and went to ground. In the distance they heard the sound of a motor and two motor cyclists came into view followed by an infantry transport truck with a Mercedes star on its radiator.

Yankel and Nathan could hardly believe their eyes. The vehicles were those of the German army used in the 1940’s, and the soldiers were wearing uniforms of the Waffen SS.

Was it a reunion of historical enthusiasts of the Third Reich?

Having analyzed all the relevent information of the surrounding environment, the on board computer of Nathan locked onto an object: a sign post in front of a crossroads a 100 metres to the left.  Zooming in on the helmet visor a word became readable: Oswiecim.

 

-          “My God, it’s impossible!”
story_txt:
“Amalek. 

They left to save Israel. They landed in hell”

 www.amalek-novel.com 
Short Summary
My name is Thibault Verbiest and I am a Belgian born author. 
I was an attorney-at-law for 20 years, heading a well-known internet law firm established in Paris, Brussels and Tel-Aviv . 
After a burn-out that left me exhausted, I decided to radically change my lifestyle and to dedicate the second part of my life to causes and challenges that are more aligned with my true inner values. I am now an executive and team coach, a web entrepreneur (e.g. a crowd funding platform) and a novelist. 
My literary voyage began on a sunny Saturday of May 2008. I was biking in a disused Racecourse of a verdant commune in Brussels when, suddenly, an idea struck me, like a whispered breath, a crazy writing project.” Israeli soldiers being teleported to the Auschwitz concentration camp”.
I immediately felt the power of this simple idea. I was captivated. The need to tell this impossible story became irresistible. With passion, I immersed myself in dozens of books, films and online material about Judaism, Holocaust, quantum physics, Kabbalah, the subtleties of the Arab-Israeli conflict, and many other topics. Sometimes I felt stuck and overwhelmed by the complexity of certain subjects, then something unexpectedly happened, a providential helping hand, a synchronicity, an almost miraculous encounter, an inspiring coincidence. Like a colonel of Tsahal (Israeli army) who sat "by chance" next to me in a bar of an international hotel in Brussels ... Or a former ambassador of Israel who showed up in front of me in a train heading for Paris, after I I uttered his name the day before ...
Three years later I was writing the word “end” on Amalek. 
Like most French-speaking writers I sent my manuscript to several publishing houses in Paris and eventually I found my publisher a few blocks away from where I live, in Waterloo, in the South suburbs of Brussels…
After a year of (successful) distribution in the French-speaking countries and on Amazon, I decided it was time to address the Anglo-Saxon world. Unfortunately we found rejection from most literary agents and publishing houses  due mostly to my lack of having an established name in UK or US…
So I decided to take matters into my own hands and to begin Indie publishing my book in English (the first 7 chapters are already available in English, see chapter 1 below). 
In the meantime I have a lot of books to write and several projects to work on such as this one. 

What people are saying about Amalek


The book has been very well received in Belgium and Paris, both by the general public and the press (see my website www.thibaultverbiest.eu and http://www.amazon.fr/Amalek-mission-sauver-Israël-destination/dp/2930627514). More importantly, I received special acknowledgments from Holocaust survivors who were moved and impressed by the realistic and sincere description of the daily life of the prisoners, as well as the resistance organizations, within the Birkenau camp.
 Many readers were also touched by the spirit of unity that blows through the work, between the sons of Abraham, the quest of my life, contributing somehow to the reconciliation of the children of the Holy Scriptures, Christians, Jews, and Muslims. 
Thibault Verbiest guides the reader with pedagogy into the meanders of Sufism, the Final Solution or quantum physics. Written with the expertise of a veteran by a debut novelist... in short, this is a book you should hear about .
Yves Thiran, journalist (RTBF, Belgian Public Television)
A completely exciting and innovative fiction novel, mixing up with talent history, geopolitical, physics quantum and Kabbalah... A powerful story, a solid mastery of style and writing.. A reference of its kind, no doubt.
Sylvie Bensaid, journalist (Tribune Juive, Paris)
I just closed the last page of Amalek and I must confess I have loved this book.. By building bridges between peoples, you show that the Universal is the goal and therefore your book will remain remembered. I found in your fast and above all excellently documented narrative style the style  that I loved in Dominique Lapierre and Larry Collins books....
Armand Broder, Belgian-Israeli lawyer

 
Synopsis of “Amalek” (700.000 characters)
In a Middle East in chaos, a fringe ultra-extremist Muslim Brotherhood sect takes control of an underground military complex located in Mount Sinai Egypt, where three portable atomic bombs are stored, ready for use. 
Hassan Al-Dawar, at the head of this fanatic group, has teamed up with U.S. General William Quaker, who is under the influence of charismatic televangelist Terry Gere, in a common vision to precipitate the End of Days. Al-Dawar and Pastor Gere both believe they have received a divine mission to hasten the parousia, Christ's return, a prelude to the advent of the Millennium.
To fulfill the prophecy, an atomic bomb must explode in Iran. Tehran will be convinced that the State of Israel is responsible for this attack and will have no choice but to retaliate by detonating a nuclear warhead at Megiddo. 
Operation “Holy Return” has begun. 
The sword of King David is stolen from the Topkapi Palace and the attack is disguised so as to suggest the involvement of the Israeli army. A nuclear plant in Iran is hacked by a virus whose code includes references to the Book of Esther, and the web is flooded with fake secret messages announcing the imminent destruction of the Shiite enemy and calling on Jews worldwide not to go to Iran. 
The plot reaches the Mossad and an emergency commando raid is mounted. The soldiers of the elite unit Matkal are trapped and all members are killed. 
A national crisis meeting is convened in Jerusalem. The Prime Minister recommends the use of nuclear weapons to destroy the Mount Sinai base but Beirach David, from Mossad, offers an alternative - to attempt an unprecedented operation: teleporting a commando to the Egyptian base using experimental quantum technology developed by the Research Institute Weizmann. 
The machine is a revolutionary type of particle collider conceived to create wormholes, tunnels in space-time. The work of the Institute is based on research carried out by Professor Bakal, a Jewish scholar who was detained at a secret base in Siberia and who was able to smuggle, through a quantum computer, the plans of the machine before he was killed. 
Beirach David is responsible for leading operation "Amalek" and has ten days to succeed. His first task is to recruit the nine soldiers of the commando. All are selected on the basis of mysterious kabbalistic criteria transmitted by Professor Bakal.
Four women are part of the commando: commander Leah Ben Gibor, a cold and cruel killer of Mossad; Sarah Shabtaï, a pacifist pro-Palestinian reporter; Iris Lahad , a beautiful and reckless Yemeni married to a religious Zionist; and Noam Melech, a lawyer of Ethiopian origin. 
The five men who complete the commando are just as eclectic: the arrogant Nathan Weisz, the son of a wealthy industrialist; Hussein Jibril, the rebel Druze; the intrepid Dr. Yuri Krassota; Tomer Haniel the kibbutznik, a paraplegic with an experimental exoskeleton; and Yankel Gnod, the soldier of God. 
After ten days of intensive training at a secret base in the Negev desert, Operation Amalek commences and the commando is teleported…but the destination is not the one intended. They land a few miles away from Auschwitz in October 1943, without knowing  why, and apparently without any possibility of return.
With the help of a Polish general they manage to extract from a neighboring camp, they hatch a plan to coordinate an uprising in the camp of Birkenau. 
The nine Israeli soldiers break into the camp of Birkenau and, through a network of Polish resistance, are assigned to strategic positions within the camp: Iris in Kanada, the area where the goods of the deportees are stored, Tomer in the Sonderkommando (crematoria), Yuri at the camp hospital, Leah becomes Kapo (a trustee inmate who supervises the prisoners) in the "barracks of French women,” Hussein in the kitchen of the camp of gypsies, Noam becomes a Jehovah's Witness and works in the villa of an SS commander, while Yankel is a truck driver. Nathan and Sarah are disguised as SS.  
An initiatory journey to the heart of hell starts for the members of the Israeli commando. 
Maximilian Grabner, head of the Gestapo camp, has made it his mission to hunt down and eliminate the elite unit. The tension never ceases as he is constantly at their heels, a breath away from succeeding in their capture. 
The day of the revolt is planned for the first night (Erev) of Yom Kippur - the Day of Atonement.
Our nine heroes discover that each is predestined and linked to one of the spheres (sephira) of the Tree of Kabbalah. This revelation transforms them as they learn who they really are and their biblical destiny. 
They will then return to save their world and Iran. And enable the emergence of a new era…
 
What I Need & What You Get
Here's what I need the money for, in order of importance (that is, order in which they will get funded depending on how much money I receive):

A professional translation of my novel into English.
Proofreading - making sure those pesky typos don't make it into the final product!
Ebook conversion - paying for professional conversion to ensure the best reading experience for digital readers. Multimedia content will be added to the ebook that does not exist in the current French physical book.
Marketing campaign including sending out free digital copies to libraries across the US/UK and digital and postcard campaigns.
Press kits to send out along with review copies of the novel to as many reviewers as possible.

You'll see to the right what you'll get at each level, but here is a brief description of the various prizes available:
·         Digital copy of Amalek 


·         Hard copy of Amalek 


·         Your name in the special thanks both in the ebook and printed version of the book


·         Your name as supporter in at the end of the future movie “Amalek”


Your impact
The “duty of memory” is a growing necessity as the last Shoa survivors will soon disappear. Memory is not maintained only by history books. We must use the language and the means of communication of the younger generations. The digital novel is a manner to talk to young people. The Holocaust is also a universal tragedy and must be a place of memory for all, whatever their culture. By helping to finance the English version of Amalek, you contribute also to my mission, building bridges between cultures and uniting peoples for a better, more tolerant and more caring world.
The English book will be also an added value for the movie “Amalek” as producers are already interested in the story. A script is now being written and my Belgian producer (http://panacheproductions.be/  ) is willing to team up with US producers to make it happen !    
Other Ways You Can Help
You can also be a great contributor by helping to get the word out about my campaign via blog, FB, twitter, email, and the Indiegogo website share tools to groups and individuals you think might invest. I appreciate you spreading the word to anyone you can think of. Maybe a New York based publishing house or literary agent;-)

story:
What is this Mantasy all about?

My name is Lyle Christie and I’m a writer, director, and martial arts instructor — or at least I used to be. Unfortunately, everything came crashing down in September of 2013 when I had a minor recurrence of lymphoma cancer and began the grueling treatments of chemotherapy, radiation, and rabbit serum. This was in preparation for a donor bone marrow transplant at Stanford which my doctors believe will cure me, once and for all. Now, facing yet another course of difficult treatment and an even longer period of isolation, I have decided to use this time to make the world a little brighter by bringing my humorous, action-adventure "Mantasy" Series alive. If I could manage to write myself out of my own personal hell, then why not bring that joy to everyone, especially fellow sufferers of cancer or any other life threatening diseases.

How is this going to work?

All you generous contributors will receive our deepest expressions of gratitude in the form of public thanks and perks {e-books, paperback copies, Mantasy coffee cups, Soft Taco Island T-shirts, 11x17 collector Posters}. Your name (or one you submit) will be given honorable mentions on the Special Thanks page at Lylechristie.com! 

All Contributions are Tax Deductible!

Every action from YOU to make this campaign a success is an act of love, support and encouragement for myself as an artist, writer and cancer survivor!

We are looking to raise $20,000.00, which will provide enough funding to:

  • print the first three books in the Mantasy Series
  • produce sweet swag to share with our supporters
  • cover shipping expenses
  • send paperback sets to various cancer centers around the world

Of course, if we don't reach our entire goal, we will use the contributions to print as many books as we can and share them in the same way, though on a smaller scale!
*detailed budget available upon request - just email: kmochristie<at>gmail.com
**T-shirts, coffee cups, posters and paperbacks will be mailed to you at the end of this campaign. We will email you the e-books and cover art immediately.

MAKE THIS SERIES SPREAD LIKE WILDFIRE: as soon as you support this Indiegogo Campaign, PLEASE TELL EVERYONE YOU'VE DONE IT, AND SPREAD THE LINK FAR AND WIDE.... (we borrowed this from Amanda Palmer)

These books were created by the author in his fight against cancer as a means of survival! Everyone can help him continue by sharing the word about the Mantasy Series. We want you to know that your involvement is helpful whether you're the most generous or the most excited fan! Help us spread the word - share the link + feel free to tell everyone about the books in the Mantasy Series.

For your efforts and generosity you will have our endless gratitude and respect! We will add your name (or the name of a loved one) to our special thanks section at Lylechristie.com — Immortalized on the web! We may even write a song for you! 

XOXO SHARE TWEET POST YELL SING PRAISE BLOG LIKE DONATE XOXO

What are readers saying about Soft Taco Island?

   

Born of Tragedy

It all began back in 2010 when I was unexpectedly diagnosed with stage 4 Non-Hodgkin’s Peripheral T-Cell Lymphoma. I went into immediate chemotherapy treatment at Kaiser and began reading the Harry Potter series, spending the many anxiety filled hours with the boy who lived, hoping to be the man who survived.  I achieved remission and was transferred to Stanford University for specialized treatment and what would be a year of intense pain, suffering, and isolation. Upon finishing the Harry Potter series, I tried my best to find new reading material but few books offered the same level of escapism of J.K. Rowling’s imaginative masterpiece.  I therefore set about creating my own world, writing my own book, and jokingly referring to it as Book 1 in the Mantasy Trilogy — Mantasy being the combination of male and fantasy.  While chemo dripped into my veins and my white blood cell count dropped to zero, I escaped the misery and confines of my veritable prison by retreating inward, writing the adventure I wanted to read.  Staring at nothing but four white walls and a clock, I took my character (and myself) on an exotic journey to the Caribbean — engaging in wacky hijinks, action, adventure, sex, food, alcohol, and most important of all, adequate alone time in the bathroom.  You see, the nurses at Stanford were obsessed with my bowel movements, which in turn made me obsessed with my privacy.  It would grow to become one of the many funny nuances of my hero and in turn, the entire series.  Book 1, Soft Taco Island was finished by the time I returned home and I had three glorious years of remission during which I managed to finish the Trilogy and write three more books, eventually changing the name to the Mantasy Series. 

My writing Background

I have been writing professionally for the last twenty years, primarily doing screenplays. I've had two optioned for feature films and another four pushed into development (whatever the hell that means). I've also been directing music videos and creating all number of wacky projects. I transitioned to proper book writing during cancer treatment because it afforded me the ability to relay a more detailed story than screenplay format.

Below is an example of the two different styles:

Screenplay Format:
INT. HOSPITAL ROOM MORNING
Lyle is sitting on the toilet in his hospital bathroom arguing with his nurse who is standing outside.
                                         Nurse Ratched
                   Please Mr. Christie, I really need to see your stool.

                                         Lyle
                   Then you'll have to pry it from my cold dead hands.


Traditional Format:
Lyle, sporting an unusually ripped physique for a cancer patient, sat crying on his hospital toilet, desperately hoping that his overbearing nurse would leave him in peace so that he could finish his morning business.

What is this Mantasy all about?My name is Lyle Christie and I’m a writer, director, and martial arts instructor — or at least I used to be. Unfortunately, everything came crashing down in September of 2013 when I had a minor recurrence of lymphoma cancer and began the grueling treatments of chemotherapy, radiation, and rabbit serum. This was in preparation for a donor bone marrow transplant at Stanford which my doctors believe will cure me, once and for all. Now, facing yet another course of difficult treatment and an even longer period of isolation, I have decided to use this time to make the world a little brighter by bringing my humorous, action-adventure "Mantasy" Series alive. If I could manage to write myself out of my own personal hell, then why not bring that joy to everyone, especially fellow sufferers of cancer or any other life threatening diseases.How is this going to work?
All you generous contributors will receive our deepest expressions of 
gratitude in the form of public thanks and perks {e-books, paperback copies, Mantasy coffee cups, Soft Taco 
Island T-shirts, 11x17 collector Posters}. Your name (or one you submit) will be given honorable mentions on the Special Thanks page at Lylechristie.com! All Contributions are Tax Deductible!Every action from YOU to make this campaign a success is an act of love, support and encouragement for myself as an artist, writer and cancer survivor! We are looking to raise $20,000.00, which will provide enough funding to:
print the first three books in the Mantasy Series

produce sweet swag to share with our supporters
cover shipping expenses
send paperback sets to various cancer centers around the world
Of course, if we don't reach our entire goal, we will use the contributions to print as many books as we can and share them in the same way, though on a smaller scale! *detailed budget available upon request - just email: kmochristie<at>gmail.com**T-shirts, coffee cups, posters and paperbacks will be mailed to you at the end of this campaign. We will email you the e-books and cover art immediately.MAKE THIS SERIES SPREAD LIKE WILDFIRE: as soon as you support this Indiegogo Campaign, PLEASE 
TELL EVERYONE YOU'VE DONE IT, AND SPREAD THE LINK FAR AND WIDE.... (we borrowed this from Amanda Palmer)These books were created by the author in his fight against cancer as a means of survival! Everyone can help him continue by sharing the word about the Mantasy Series. We want you to know that your involvement is helpful whether you're the most generous or the most excited fan! Help us spread the word - share the link +
feel free to tell everyone about the books in the Mantasy Series. For your efforts and generosity you will have our endless gratitude and respect! We will add your name (or the name of a loved one) to our special thanks section at Lylechristie.com — Immortalized on the web! We may even write a song for you! XOXO SHARE TWEET POST YELL SING PRAISE BLOG LIKE DONATE XOXOWhat are readers saying about Soft Taco Island?
    Born of TragedyIt all began back in 2010 when I was 
unexpectedly diagnosed with stage 4 Non-Hodgkin’s Peripheral T-Cell 
Lymphoma. I went into immediate chemotherapy treatment at Kaiser and 
began reading the Harry Potter series, spending the many anxiety filled 
hours with the boy who lived, hoping to be the man who survived.  I 
achieved remission and was transferred to Stanford University for 
specialized treatment and what would be a year of intense pain, 
suffering, and isolation. Upon finishing the Harry Potter series, I 
tried my best to find new reading material but few books offered the 
same level of escapism of J.K. Rowling’s imaginative masterpiece.  I 
therefore set about creating my own world, writing my own book, and 
jokingly referring to it as Book 1 in the Mantasy Trilogy — Mantasy 
being the combination of male and fantasy.  While chemo dripped into my 
veins and my white blood cell count dropped to zero, I escaped the 
misery and confines of my veritable prison by retreating inward, writing
 the adventure I wanted to read.  Staring at nothing but four white 
walls and a clock, I took my character (and myself) on an exotic journey
 to the Caribbean — engaging in wacky hijinks, action, adventure, sex, 
food, alcohol, and most important of all, adequate alone time in the 
bathroom.  You see, the nurses at Stanford were obsessed with my bowel 
movements, which in turn made me obsessed with my privacy.  It would 
grow to become one of the many funny nuances of my hero and in turn, the

story:
Thank you to everyone who supported!




*


"Daniel had the chutzpah to quit an excellent job, leave his friends and home to travel the world on his own. Tell me you aren’t dying to know his secret."

- Canadian Living Magazine



Hello, my name is Daniel. I’m a writer, and I need your help to get my new indie travel memoir into the world. But first, let me tell you about a journey that I went on.  

On January 1, 2011, I left my homeland of Canada to embark on a yearlong travel project. But it was more than just a year of travel – it was a series of twelve carefully chosen work-exchange arrangements that allowed me to connect with communities and stray far off the beaten backpacker trail. 

Since returning from my trip, I’ve written a book that shares all the highs, lows and unexpected surprises that marked my adventure. It’s called The Traveller. To get this book into the world, I need a bit of financial backing. That’s why we’re here together.



The Story

The Traveller is a full-length travel memoir that recounts the joys and disappointments of pursuing a dream journey. Written with a bit of introspection and a heap of humour, the book is a literary snapshot of twelve distinct global destinations. What emerges is a portrait of an individual trying to be helpful in a variety of volunteer positions and of all the people who subsequently help him along the way.

Instead of numerical chapters, The Traveller is divided into twelve months. Each month is a unique story that builds toward a larger personal adventure.

Prologue
January: USA, Community Rebuilding Organization
February: Costa Rica, Organic Raw Vegan Farm
March: Peru, Elementary School
April: Buenos Aires, Hospitality Agency
May: South Africa, Art Space & Used Clothing Boutique
June: Morocco, Community Centre
July: France, Medieval Restoration Project
August: Scotland, Edinburgh Fringe Festival
September: Israel, Goat Farm
October: India, Yoga Retreat
November: Laos, Literacy Organization
December: Australia, Secret Locale
Epilogue


Want to sample more of the book? Read excerpts on Cowbird . . .



The Cost of Independent Publishing

In the same self-directed spirit of my journey, I have decided to release this book independently. (For more information on why I’ve chosen my method of publication, check out my article, Why I’ve Chosen Self-Publishing, Or As I Prefer, “Team-Publishing.”) Essentially, I’ve opted for a process that enables certain creative liberties, but this process also comes with a price tag.

So what does independent publishing involve? Here are some rough figures:

$ 850  - Cover design by one of Canada’s top graphic designers Michel Vrana
$1500 - Proofreading by professional proof-reader Jennifer McFee
$1500 - Typesetting (approximated)
$3000 - FSC-certified printing fees with Marquis Books

$6850* - Approximate total for a first-run of 1000 print copies

But wait. Why is the fundraising goal of this campaign only $5000? Well that's the bare minimum needed to get this puppy into printed form! As an independent artist and entrepreneur, it's part of the game to invest my own dollars as well. Essentially, I think this project is cool, so I'm also willing to help fund it. But I can't do it alone. 

* Not included in this summary of costs are professional editing services. The editor of The Traveller, Monique James, shares dividends in the book (which are projected to come in the long-term). I have it on good authority that she would really love for you to support this project.



The Perks of Being a Funder

Indiegogo projects are about exchange and support—a hand up, not a hand out. And my project is no different. The most exciting reason to toss a couple of dollars my way is to get your hands on a copy of The Traveller. For a breezy $25 you’ll get a limited first edition, print version of the book. For those willing to up the ante, there are a couple of other titillating perks, such as prints of the photographs I took from around the world, hand knit accessories (yes, I knit), and maybe even dinner together!

And remember, no matter what tier you select, you’ll get your named printed in the book as an official “Associate Traveller.” That's right: YOUR NAME INSIDE THE BOOK.

(Think of the hot dates that will get you!)

So hop aboard this train, already.



Sharing is Caring

So you’re a bit down on cash? No worries, I can empathize. One of the best ways to help is simply to help promote my project. Statistically speaking, you’ve probably got a Facebook account. It would be extremely helpful if you’d share the link to this campaign on your profile page! Fan of Tumblr? Feel free to steal any (or all) of my images and videos. Find this campaign interesting? Well then Pin it! Do you use the Twitter? Great. Well here are three pre-written tweets! Just copy n’ paste!

Are you a traveller? Well then you’ll want to nab this book: igg.me/at/TheTraveller #TheTraveller

Blogger @Daniel_Baylis volunteered his way around the world. Check out his story: igg.me/at/TheTraveller #TheTraveller

Travel is sexy. So is the concept of this book. Damn. igg.me/at/TheTraveller #TheTraveller


Use those little buttons (located under the video) to help spread the word.

Thank you. Merci. Gracias. Shukran. Toda. Dhan'yavāda. Khàwp ja̖i.




Professional Biography

Daniel's trip was chronicled on his popular blog, The Conversationalist, and was featured in Business Insider, Canadian Living and on CBC Radio.  His writing credits include The Guardian, Fast Company and Huffington Post, as well as content collaborations with Tourisme Montreal, enRoute Magazine and N/A Marketing. In 2011 Advocate Magazine named him a "Top 40 Under 40."  Daniel currently divides his time between Montreal and Victoria.


*


"[Daniel is] a socially engaged wayfarer bartering his skills for food and accommodation, reporting back with witty and often spiritual observations."

- 2B Magazine

story:
(cover art by Jen Cooney!)

I started writing this book in 2006, based on two events: 1) my mom, who has a tendency to make wacky proclamations, called me up one day and said, "You should write a book that's like the babysitters' club, but about punk houses. The Punk House Club!" 2) out of complete and utter boredom and perhaps passive-aggressiveness, I wrote a four-page story based on my girlfriend-at-the-time's compost pile. She lived in a Food Not Bombs house and the compost pile was huge (think like 8' x 2' x 2', or maybe even bigger) and I liked to complain about it. One day, instead of complaining, I used my energy to write a story about two girls who find a severed hand in their out-of-control compost pile. I had so much fun writing it, I decided to keep going. One day I realized that I was no longer writing a story but writing a book.

This book took four years of off-and-on work. Although it was hard, those were some of the happiest times for me--staying up late, just me and the radio at two AM, living inside this world I'd created.  And one day I realized that I knew the ending, and I typed it, and I printed it out and held it in my arms, hugged it so tightly, and then took the above selfie in my bathroom. I was really happy.

I then spent the next few years trying to get it published. I labored over synopses, cover letters, and book proposals, trying to push the pointy edges of this project into a box that might be labeled "publishable." But nobody was buying.

Was my book bad? Is that why nobody wanted to publish it? It's hard to be objective. Of course I love my book. I've raised it. It's mine. But even with that in mind, I think my book needs to come out. Every time I've read from it, I get a strong reaction from the audience. The few friends who've read it as a Word document have said that it's inspired them to have difficult conversations, remember things more fondly, or be more proud of the way that we live our lives.

I started reading more manifestoes from queer, trans, lady, and/or feminist writers. They made a compelling case that publishing is just so corporate. Getting rejected doesn't mean that you've written a bad book, it just means that our lives are never gonna turn a profit, not large enough to live on. But our stories are still important. They still need to be heard. And they will still make a difference to the people who need them.

I decided to do the work myself. I decided to stop waiting for a person who I don't know, a faceless publishing intern picking through the slush pile, to validate me and my book. We can validate ourselves.

I've decided to learn InDesign, marketing, HTML and the like. I decided to get my book printed by 1984 Printing, an awesome, recycled-paper, soy-ink, woman-owned printing press in Oakland. But there are some things that I can't do on my own, and one of them is pay the printer's bill. Self-publishing requires a lot of money up front that I simply don't have at the moment. My page count isn't finalized yet, but it looks like it's going to cost at least $2500 for the first print run. I can't do it alone, peepz. This is where you come in.

The Most Beautiful Rot is a secret peek into the backyards and living rooms of young queer america. It’s a testament to the act of digging through the bleakness of everyday life to find something beautiful growing underneath, something that you weren’t expecting. This book is also about overflowing dumpsters, stupid men, catastrophic illness, hot queer makeouts, and a compost pile gone horribly wrong. It’s about solidarity, kale, girl love, and the families we make when our other families leave us behind.

The story is narrated by four housemates: Tabitha, Xandria, Jasmine and Lydia. First we meet Tabitha, the youngest, newest housemate who’s super-excited to have discovered this new way of life, until she discovers something untoward in the compost pile. She tries to seek revenge, but even that goes awry. Next, the focus is turned over to Xandria, our reformed crusty who’s wrestling with some ghosts from her past that won’t stop haunting her. Jasmine takes over the narration next with her dreamy, poetic style that culminates in a shocking–and devastating–revelation. Lydia carries us towards the end with her sassy take on things, utilizing her strength to fight the huge change that is threatening to tear their chosen family apart.

The Most Beautiful Rot is sassy, funny, heartbreaking, devastating, surprising and revelatory. It loves you back. It wants you to take it home and hang out with your other books. Don’t make it sad, buy a copy! Support independent queer art! (p.s. e-book fans, this book will eventually be released in your preferred format. but for now, i love print forever, i don't care if it may be considered expensive & inconvenient. so please be patient!)

story:
SEGUIDA KIDZ - BRONX URBAN TALES

My name is Steve Adorno. aka / Stevie Beatz. Musician, Author. I was born and raised in the Bronx in New York City. I'm from a "Hood" called "The One Seven Four". That's where the SEGUIDA KIDZ  Band originates. SEGUIDA KIDZ is based on my true musical life story about how I, along with my childhood friends, decided to start a band instead of joining the local street gang in our neighborhood. The Band begins to perform at block parties & street festivals all over the neighborhood. They meet Mike De Mic , a fast talking but lovable music biz manager, and he takes them on an amazing and zany journey to the top!  The SEGUIDA KIDZ become the #1 Band in the world. It's the band's encounters with members of the Savage 88's gang from the other side of the "hood" that will take them on adventures of danger & excitement. The band changed all of our lives forever. It gave us a sense of empowerment at a young age and also set an example for so many other kids in our neighborhood. Thru the power of our music, we showed kids that you could make better choices. You didn't have to be bullied into joining a gang or to sell drugs or doing things your mama told you not to do! This is an on going issue encountered by many young people around the world. Especially kids who grow up in an urban enviornment. SEGUIDA KIDZ confronts these and other urban issues with stories that will be based in the reality of my musical life growing up in the Bronx. 

SEGUIDA KIDZ Production Goals

My campaign is to raise a $7000 Production Budget. Contributions will be used to hire Top Professional Artists like the amazing Bronx Born Dave Rodriguez  to draw & bring to life my original SEGUIDA KIDZ characters. Dave's work in the world of animation over the years is well known throughout the Cartoon industry. I am honored to have this opportunity to work with this very talented artist. The budget is to be spent on SEGUIDA KIDZ storyboards and page design layouts for the children's book series, web comic book series, graphic novels, and animation cartoon webasodes. I myself will be composing and producing the SEGUIDA KIDZ songs and music cd's so you can expect lots of world beatz and urban treatz! it’s important for me to tell my story to young people and with the help of You and the SEGUIDA KIDZ, we can inspire them and teach them that they have a choice. They don't have to just "follow the crowd". They can "follow their dreams"... like i did. The SEGUIDA KIDZ  will always deliver this musical message in a fun and original way.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the Breakdown:

  •  Funding of $7000 is needed as a "start up production budget" to hire the artist needed for the creation of story boards for the animation cartoon webasode series and Page artwork for the children's book.
  • Come join the band with a three tier choice of levels for your contributions that will reveal unique perks (your name in the books credits, Signed 1st edition books, Signed art print, Signed music cd's & more..) depending on your investment ($25 , $100 , $1000 ).

SEGUIDA KIDZ - BRONX URBAN TALES
My name is Steve Adorno. aka / Stevie Beatz. Musician, Author. I was born and raised in the Bronx in New York City. I'm from a "Hood" called "The One Seven Four". That's where the SEGUIDA KIDZ  Band originates. SEGUIDA KIDZ is based on my true musical life story about how I, along with my childhood friends, decided to start a band instead of joining the local street gang in our neighborhood. The Band begins to perform at block parties & street festivals all over the neighborhood. They meet Mike De Mic , a fast talking but lovable music biz manager, and he takes them on an amazing and zany journey to the top!  The SEGUIDA KIDZ become the #1 Band in the world. It's the band's encounters with members of the Savage 88's gang from the other side of the "hood" that will take them on adventures of danger & excitement. The band changed all of our lives forever. It gave us a sense of empowerment at a young age and also set an example for so many other kids in our neighborhood. Thru the power of our music, we showed kids that you could make better choices. You didn't have to be bullied into joining a gang or to sell drugs or doing things your mama told you not to do! This is an on going issue encountered by many young people around the world. Especially kids who grow up in an urban enviornment. SEGUIDA KIDZ confronts these and other urban issues with stories that will be based in the reality of my musical life growing up in the Bronx.

The budget is to be spent on SEGUIDA KIDZ storyboards and page design layouts for the children's book series, web comic book series, graphic novels, and animation cartoon webasodes. I myself will be composing and producing the SEGUIDA KIDZ songs and music cd's so you can expect lots of world beatz and urban treatz! it’s important for me to tell my story to young people and with the help of You and the SEGUIDA KIDZ, we can inspire them and teach them that they have a choice. story:
I am on a mission to help women live on purpose, work their passion and practice prosperity!

My name is Tai Goodwin and I am a coach, blogger, and author in progress. I've been writing Monday Morning pep Talks for the last three years. Every week I get an email from someone that has been inspired by one of the notes they've recieved. By putting together 52 notes, one for each week in a year, I am hoping to spread the inspiration to more people, and create more magnificent Mondays.

The ideas for the Pep Talks started back when I was a teacher. As much as I loved teaching, I spent every Sunday night in a panic attack - so just imagine what Monday morning was like. I started giving myself pep talks. Eventually I left teaching and dove into corporate America. From there I launched a coaching business while working full-time. Balancing life, work and business required lots of pep talks to keep me from giving up on the business and holding onto the day job. In 2009 I started sharing my pep talks with my friends via Facebook, then my blog, then my newsletter.

Now I want to share the pep talks with more people who could use a little nudge and inspiration on their own journey towards living on purpose, working their passion and practicing prosperity. 

About the Book

I've written some new pep talks, and updated some of my most popular pep talks, and invited a few women who I admire and think are totally cool to contribute a pep talk as well. In addition to the pep talks, I am including monthly audio affirmations, along with inspirational quotes, and stories. The book will be available in digital format as well as hard copy.

Here's a sample Pep Talk: The Real Reason You'll Never Make a Million Dollars.

Contributors (Partial List)

  • Stephanie C. Harper, CAREER Magazine 
  • Marsha Egan, Leadership Expert and Author
  • Mairo Akpose-Simpson, The Working Wife
  • Melanie Keveles, Starting Fresh Coaching 
  • Betty Liedtke, Find Your Buried Treasure
  • Delisha Easley, Not Everyone Is Having Sex
  • Primrose Oteng, The Positive Peace Project
  • Zara Green, The Grown Zone

The Impact: Inspire Ordinary Women with Extraordinary Dreams for Influencing Their Family, Community, and World

Your contribution supports:

  • $500 : Editing and Proofreading
  • $600 : Design and Layout
  • $700 : Publishing and Distribution
  • $500 : Marketing and Promotion

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial support is not the only way you can get involved! You can help create more magnificent Mondays by:

  • Being a stop on the blog tour (I'm looking for 12 blogs to host)
  • Writing a review and share it on your blog or with your network
  • Joining the Monday Morning Pep Rally on Facebook and Twitter (more details coming)

A little more about me...

This is my first crowdfunded project and I am looking forward to the IndieGoGo experience and the wonderful contribitors who will help launch this project. You can read my blog at www.launchwhileworking.com, connect to me on Facebook, or follow me on Twitter.

story:
Our Story

About 911: Voices from the Outsider Media

In the immediate hours, days and weeks following the life-altering morning of 9/11, I received a flood of emails reflecting a broad spectrum of ideas. I saved them and have never lost sight of the significance of this body of sentiments, or the hope of one day publishing and sharing them with the world. That day has finally come.

Approaching this tenth anniversary of 9/11, I am feverishly endeavoring to publish these writings in an anthology entitled 911: Voices from the Outsider Media. The book reveals those voices unheard through mainstream channels and includes personal accounts, historical facts as well as fiction, comic relief, inspiration and more. Penned and forwarded by everyday people and public figures alike, these entries encapsulate the moment, creating a powerful representation of global thought and the myriad expressions swirling between continents via the Internet - a tool we had only just begun to explore.

We have since seen an explosion in the Internet and are witnessing how social media has given birth to revolutions and engulfed our lives. But, in 2001 the Internet was still finding its way into people's homes; the breadth of its utility not yet fully defined. And, the general public was just beginning to exercise opinions through this channel; we were on the threshhold of the blog, circulating original thought and developing an understanding that we, the voiceless, could now be heard. We certainly didn’t start a revolution with these 9/11 emails, but we did heal and comfort, educate, inform, and in some cases, scare the bejesus out of one another in an effort to process this unprecedented American tragedy.

911: Voices from the Outsider Media includes over 100 selected entries from around the world. I gleaned the importance of these exchanges when a friend - not connected to the Internet at the time - asked that I print some of this out to share with her. It was then that I recognized the sheer volume and importance of the varied information that had invaded my mailbox. Whether I agree or disagree with some of it is of no consequence, the historical significance of this work lays in the fact that it renders an uncensored picture of a global society during the most life-changing moment in most of our histories. This is, on the subject of 9/11, an authentic record of the minority voice and an opportunity to thoughtfully re-examine the past 10 years.

 

Bringing the Project to Life

Realizing this project has included long days and nights of editing and reaching out to contributors for rights and permissions. I have enlisted the help of professionals to help with book formatting, cover design and the production of promotional materials (including video and print materials). In addition, setting up the basic processes for book-publishing are underway; including securing the appropriate licenses, printing the book, building inventory, setting up distribution and marketing the project. With the content having been established 10 years ago, now it's just a matter of putting it all together and presenting it to YOU!

People have to be paid. Product has to be purchased...and every step of this process has its costs. Funds from this drive will be used to support all of the above tasks, many of which are already in progress in an effort to launch the book before the tenth anniversary of September 11th. I realize I have set an ambitious goal - $5,000 - but, truth be told, much more is actually needed to bring this project to the market in the grand fashion it deserves. So, please feel free to be generous but, keep in mind, that every penny helps and will be used to make 911: Voices from the Outsider Media a reality.

 

Thank you in advance for your support - I especially appreciate it in these tremendously difficult times.

 

 

About Your Rewards

While 911: Views from the Outsider Media contains a wide range of expressions – from Petitions for Peace to calls for war – and I feel it is my duty to present ALL of these authentic messages, I also feel it is my responsibility to promote and highlight the positive; that which continues to be inspiring and life-affirming. With that in mind, I will be pulling out excerpts to create a collection of auxiliary materials for funders. In addition, all supporters will receive discounts on Omo Misha products redeemable for 1 year, will receive special invitations to all related events, and will be regularly updated on the life of the project. I appreciate your presence on this journey!

FAQ

 
 
Other Ways You Can Help

First of all, please, please, please share this campaign with your community - Facebook, Twitter, email, word-of-mouth - whatever you can do to help us get the word out! Once the book is out (actually, even before), we will need to launch a MASS media campaign to let the book industry and the general public know about it. Anything you can do to help in this area would be greatly appreciated too. I am open for your ideas, suggestions, criticisms and professional advice....THANK YOU!!!

story:
Writer's Retreat Inspirational City Guides:

When living in a busy city or traveling to one it's often difficult to find a place where you're able to tap into your right brain's creativity. The Writer's Retreat team wants to bring you a listing of the best independent eateries in your neighborhood or vacation destination. It has a selection of the best cafes, restaurants and coffee shops for writers, bloggers and students.
 
The locations are loiterer friendly with great food, coffee and staff. The New York City edition has over 100 cafes listed according to the neighborhoods in Manhattan, Brooklyn, The Bronx, Queens and Staten Island. A collection of Inspirational Itineraries that take you to landmarks not often found in other guide books are also included to aid in ridding you of that pesky writer's block.
 
Help us support small businesses across the country!
 

Our Team:
 
Author: Juliet C. Obodo

Juliet C. Obodo a travel and fantasy author (Written in the Sky*Rise of the Wadjet Witch) also writes a column titled Reader's Retreat for IndieReader.com. She spotlights great cafes to sit and read while enjoying a great espresso. She focuses on small independent businesses that are often overlooked for not having enough "ratings" or exposure on the internet. For more information and free travel guides visit her blog Traveling*Indie*Writer*Chick.
 
Illustrator: Jonique Williams
 
 
Jonique Williams is a New York-based illustrator with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Illustration from the School of Visual Arts. Her work spans a variety of visual markets from editorial to book illustration. Please visit her website for more information here.
 
 

What We Need & What You Get

We've already published the New York City Edition and it is available as an ebook and in print. But we're working on the second edition with updated listings and a beautiful new cover.

We were approached by a traditional publisher who wanted to purchase the copyrights, but they wouldn't publish the guides until 2014! We want to spread the word now. And with your help we can!
 
This is a pre-order campaign. We need $5,000 to pay for the cost of printing and distributing the travel guides.
 
The other half will be matched by the tourism board. This will pay for shipping and marketing the guides.
 
So you'll get them at 60% off the retail price!
 
 
1. New York
 
2. Los Angeles
 
3. San Francisco
 
4. Seattle
 
5. Chicago
 
6. New Orleans
 
7. Austin
 
8. Portland
 
9. Boston
 
10.Miami

 

 

Individual Backers:

Receive perks by the dollar amount that they donate.

$6- One ebook & one print book

$12- Digital copies of all of the guides for your e-reader & one print book

$25- Digital & print copies of all of the travel guides

 

Business Sponsors:

The guides will now feature places to Eat, Sleep, Drink, Shop & other Services.

This will give small businesses an opportunity to reach visitors and locals who purchase our guides.

 

$50- An ad on the sponsor page at the back of any Writer's Retreat City Guide. The page will remain in that edition of the book whether it's in print or e-book.

Along with complimentary copies of all the city guides
 
$100-An ad on the sponsor page at the back of all of the U.S. Writer's Retreat City Guides. All of the cities will be published by June 2012. The page will remain in that edition of the book whether it's in print or e-book.

Along with complimentary copies of all the city guides

 
 

Writer's Retreat Demographics:
 
  • College Students/Graduates
  • Smartphone owners
  • Tech Savvy
  • Coffee Enthusiasts
  • Creative Professionals
What you will receive: A space on our sponsor page according to industry. The books are well edited with the best cafes for individuals with discerning tastes so you will be in good company.
 
 
 
 

This is a very unique branding opportunity! Take a look at the guide below.


 

 

 

The Impact

While Juliet was working on her first novel she often felt blocked or was distracted by the construction going on in her apartment building. She tried to work at a major coffee chain, but it was usually too busy and crowded. She discovered a local cafe just a few blocks away which led her to find other great cafes in New York City. She began traveling to other cities and was surprised by the number of great cafes out there that weren't doing well because of lack of exposure.
 
They helped her find inspiration and a quiet place to finish her novel. She wrote the book as a thank you to these indie businesses.
 
With your help the guides will be completed and available for purchase just in time for graduation season. They will be sold online and in college bookstores; people will be able to discover these great locations and support small business owners all over the country.
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Tweet. Like us on Facebook. Chat about it while you're in a cafe. Or download a copy of Writer's Retreat New York City Edition on Amazon for $3.99.

She tried to work at a major coffee chain, but it was usually too busy and crowded. She discovered a local cafe just a few blocks away which led her to find other great cafes in New York City. She began traveling to other cities and was surprised by the number of great cafes out there that weren't doing well because of lack of exposure.
 
They helped her find inspiration and a quiet place to finish her novel. She wrote the book as a thank you to these indie businesses.
 
With your help the guides will be completed and available for purchase just in time for graduation season. They will be sold online and in college bookstores; people will be able to discover these great locations and support small business owners all over the country.
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Tweet. Like us on Facebook. Chat about it while you're in a cafe. Or download a copy of Writer's Retreat New York City Edition on Amazon for $3.99.

story:
Short Summary

I am a writer and editor. My works have been published in several venues. Links to a few of my writings can be found here: http://ahmedakhan.blogspot.ca/2007/11/links-to-my-writing.html

I have edited anthologies including, "SF Waxes Philosophical", and "A Mosque Among the Stars". Currently, I am editing an anthology called "Dandelions on Mars: A Tribute to Ray Bradbury".

This Idiegogo project is my first non-fiction book.

Islam is in the news so often these days that it is important (and interesting) to understand the different streams of Islam. Shia Islam is the second largest Islamic stream. This book aims to provide an insider's view of Shia Islam, presented anecdotally, to make it thoroughly readable.

Utilization of Funds

The funds will be used to publish and market the book both in the print and electronic media. If the goal is not reached, then the book will be published on in the electronic medium.

 

Please fund!

story:
Short Summary

"Do These Things or You Will Die…5 Secrets to a Long, Healthy, & Energetic Life!" was inspired by a multitude of friends & family who died (many at a young age) the past few years from cancer. Instead of the cancer fatality rate going down, the number of cancer cases & fatalities is growing exponentially every year & is now epidemic with almost 1,500,000 new diagnoses of cancer estimated in 2009 alone. 68% of all U.S. adults are overweight & ¼ of the U.S. residents are grossly obese (over 30% in some southern States) and 8% of the American now have diabetes which that does not count the undiagnosed or new cases not yet reported. The U.S. population is headed towards a widespread health nightmare let alone the burden of increasing costs to care for tens of millions millions of sick residents who have no health insurance.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for $750.00 which will help pay for you the graphic designers for the book cover & layout of the book as well as the 1st batch of books to be printed. We will be donating books at all the book signings we do at public libraries and schools to help educate the public and save lives!

 

The Impact

After working for Medco and other pharmaceutical & medical companies for so many years, I have found there ARE alternatives that can in many cases prevent cancer and other terminal illnesses. That is the whole premise of this book to educate people and save lives before it is too late!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support this cause, or afford to buy a book, please share this link with anyone you know who has health problems, a diease, or cancer.

And that’s all there is to it.
